Valens is 31 years old. He is married with three children between the ages of two and nine. Two attend school. 

He has farmed for 11 years and will use the loan from kiva, to buy fertilizer to grow and sell maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his employees.
------------------------
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow and sell maize.

loans.name: Ignace

texts.en:
Ignace is 24 years old. He is married with one child who is one year old. 

He has farmed for 25 years and will use the loan from Kiva, to buy fertilizers to grow and sell maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his employees.
-------------------------------------
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow and sell maize.

loans.name: Iidephonse

texts.en:
Ildephonse is 48 years old. He is married with five children between the ages of two and 14.  Four of them go to school. 

He has farmed for 19 years and will use the loan from Kiva, to buy fertilizer to grow and sell maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his employees.
--------------------------------------
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow and sell maize.

loans.name: Mayuri Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
Bhagvatiben (pictured at center) owns a small-scale business of selling vegetables. Her family consists of five members, including two young children. Despite all the household responsibilities, she is ready to expand her business to the next level. By expansion, she means to keep a wide variety of vegetables such as potatoes, onions, carrots, garlic, cabbages, etc. Because of a lack of funds available to invest, she is unable to grow her business.

To source the necessary microfinance that will cover her expansion capital, Bhagvatiben formed a group with four other like-minded local women entrepreneurs. The team she leads comprises Anuben, who caters meals through her tiffin center, Ranjanben with her ‘cutlery’ business selling accessories, Sarasvatiben, who sells snacks, and Jyotsana with her sari-selling microenterprise. They collectively seek to crowdfund a loan of Rs. 65,000 towards the growth of their businesses.

With her share of the loan, Bhagvatiben will purchase in bulk the vegetables that have a higher local demand and fetch a better retail price. Buying in bulk will help her negotiate better rates with her suppliers and also save her the cost of transporting them back to her place in multiple trips. She will also be able to serve more customers. The investment and subsequent growth will help her enterprise earn an extra Rs. 6,000 per month. This amount will double her contribution towards her household income and savings. It will also leave enough money each month to reinvest in developing her business and to repay the loan.

Coming from a financially weak family, Bhagvatiben could not continue her education, and had to leave her studies unfinished after attending primary school. But, like her group members, she has an unswerving faith that through her hard work, she will not let the young children in her family leave their education midway because of the very same reason. Your support in her endeavor to increase her income and savings will help Bhagvatiben achieve this goal of guaranteeing education for the children in her family.

loans.use: to stock up on produce such as potatoes, onions, cabbages, carrots, and garlic, and expand her vegetable-selling microenterprise.

loans.name: Banaras

texts.en:
Banaras, 49 years old, is a married woman. Her son (also shown in the photo) has been successfully running a general store. He offers a variety of daily-use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, he needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand.

For this reason, Banaras has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for her son, who wants to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar and juices, etc. In this way, he will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at his store and improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc to consistently meet the increasing demand at the store and improve earnings.

loans.name: Halilillo

texts.ru: Халилилло, 23 года, не женат, детей нет, но на содержании у Халилилло - два младших брата. У Халилилло среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2010 года занимается торговлей в арендованном магазине. На сегодняшний день его товарооборот составляет 150,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль- 15,000 сом (KGS), что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Халилилло обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товара в обороте. Доходы от кредита Халилилло планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Halilillo is 23 years old. He is not married and does not have children, but supports his two younger brothers. Halilillo has secondary education. 

As a main source of income for his family, Halilillo has worked with retail since 2010, in a rented store. Currently his turnover is 150,000 som (KGS). The monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS), which is the basis for covering the family's food and living expenses.

With an aim to further develop his business, Halilillo turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to increase his turnover. He plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing his business.

loans.use: to increase the assortment in his shop in order to attract more customers

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is taking a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is married and she has four children. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as slippers, candles, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, cigarettes and water. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $500.  She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy slippers, candles, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, cigarettes and water

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina es una mujer de 46 años de edad, casada, con hijos independientes, y su negocio es la venta de papa.
Ella es paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, fuerte, emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ un área rural que se caracteriza por su crecimiento y por su potencial comercial y productivo. Ubicado en un valle semi-tropical, dónde la venta de comida es abundante, variada y todo se acompaña con chicha (bebida fermentada de maíz). De clima templado durante todo el año.
Evangelina es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombreo, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio interdepartamental de tubérculos, sus hijos ya son independientes y trabajan, viven en una casa construida de ladrillo que no ha sido terminada y se encuentra a medio construir, para ingresar se debe saltar varios obstáculos como piedras, maderas, fierros y otros, cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo utilizando una bomba eléctrica para extraerla. Su sueño es ver finalizada la construcción de su casa. Ella desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene construyendo su casa.
Es por esos motivos que Evangelina solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable a su cocina, baño y lavandería para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Evangelina is a 46-year-old woman, married with independent children. She sells potatoes as her business.
She is patient, a good listener, community-oriented, strong, enterprising, responsible, and hard-working. She runs her business in the Sacana region, a rural area known for its growth and business potential. It is located in a semi-tropical valley, where food sales are abundant, varied, and always accompanied with chicha (a fermented corn drink). The climate is temperate all year long.
Evangelina is dark-skinned with long black braided hair. She dresses traditionally (sombrero, shawl and full skirt). Her mother tongue is Quechua, which is spoken in the area. She speaks Spanish because of the general culture and because of her business. She shares her life with her husband, who sells tubers to other departments. Their children are independent and work. Evangelina and her husband live in a brick home that has not been finished; it is half-built. In order to get in, one has to jump over various obstacles such as stones, wood, and iron. They have electricity and well-water which they extract with an electronic pump. Her dream is to see her home finished. She wants to install potable water in her kitchen, bathroom and laundry room in order to have a greater quality of life. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in her five years of building her home.
For these reasons, Evangelina is requesting a loan to install potable water in her kitchen, bathroom and laundry room in order to have a greater quality of life.

loans.use: to install potable water in her kitchen, bathroom and laundry room in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 52 years old. He is married with five children between the ages of eight and 33. Two attend school. 

He has farmed for 19 years and will use the loan from kiva, to buy fertilizer to grow and sell maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his employees.
------------------------------
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow and sell maize.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is married and she is a businesswoman. She is very interested in doing business. She has been involved in business activities since 2011 with her own working capital of USD 200 and she makes the best of it. 

Filomena is requesting a loan of  USD 600 to improve her business. She wants to run her business as a bigger store in the future, so she is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more goods, including milk, sardines, soap, shampoo, biscuits, and other things to sell. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy milk, sardines, soap, shampoo, biscuits, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 38 years old. He is married with three children ages one to seven. Two attend school. 

He has farmed for 12 years and will use the loan from Kiva, to buy fertilizers to grow and sell maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his employees.
-------------------------------------
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow and sell maize.

loans.name: Azizmo

texts.ru: Азизмо женщина 50 лет , замужем , счастливая мать пятерых детей и бабушка двенадцати внуков . Она окончила девять классов школы , не получила ни среднего образования,ни высшего . Но несмотря на это , она не жалуется на свою жизнь . Вот уже на протяжение тридцати с лишним лет она занимается животноводством и выращиванием урожая. Пусть это и тяжелый труд ,требующий стойкости и физической силы , она сама справляется со всем. У неё в стаде 10 баранов и 3 коровы. Она любит свой скот и хорошо ухаживает за ним, наверное,поэтому молоко ,полученное от коров,хорошо скупается на рынке . Она собирается купить корм для скота на зиму , но не имеет на данный момент полной суммы для покупки .Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой . Она заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за доверие и поддержку.
texts.en:
Azizmo is a woman of 50 years. She is married and the happy mother of four children. She has twelve grandchildren. Azizmo finished the tenth grade at school, but did not get secondary or higher education. Despite this she does not complain about her life. 

Azizmo has worked with livestock breeding and crop cultivation for a period of more than 30 years already. Even if this is hard work that requires stamina and physical strength, she is able to cope with everything. She has a herd of ten rams and three cows. She loves her livestock and takes good care of it, and therefore the milk she gets from the cows sells well at the market. 

Azizmo decided to purchase fodder for the winter for the livestock, but does not currently have the full amount for the purchase. Therefore she turned to "MDO Arvand" for financial support. She thanks "MDO Arvand" in advance for the faith and support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock fodder for the winter

loans.name: Umbelina

texts.en:
Umbelina is 27 years old, married, and has two children. She operates a kiosk in front of her house. Umbelina lives in a town near a school so her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people shop including students. She earns a good income.

Umbelina requested a loan from Tuba Rai Metin for $800, which she will use to purchase oils, refrigerator, coffee, sugar, salt, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, beer, cigarettes, water, fish, and noodles.

loans.use: to purchase oils, refrigerator, coffee, sugar, salt, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, beer, cigarettes, water, fish, and noodles

loans.name: Kory Chuyma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KORY CHUYMA” iniciará el décimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mary es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de salchipapas, venta de productos de aseo, venta de tucumanas, tienda de barrio, venta de tapetes, venta de manteles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mary es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su suegra que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de tapetes; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, ya que desde colegio inicio su negocio aprendiendo el mismo en las clases de técnica, en la actualidad sigue trabajando con esta técnica. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana y tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kory Chuyma" is starting its 7th loan cycle with Pro Mujer.  They meet in the Santiago II central office.  This group has 8 members, and is led by a board of directors where Mary is the president.  The members of this group have a variety of businesses, including: food (sausage and french fries) sales, personal products sales, meat pastry sales, a neighborhood store, rug sales, and tablecloth sales.

The loan that they are taking will benefit all of the small-businesswomen in Mary's communal bank.  She states that she joined Pro Mujer 5 years ago at the invitation of her mother-in-law, who is a client of the institution.  At this time, she has a small business selling tablecloths.  She got to know this business, which she started up a number of years ago, by learning to make tablecloths in technical classes.  She currently continues to work using these same techniques.

Mary will use this loan to increase her capital (to buy wool and fabric at wholesale that she will buy from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz).  Later, she will sell the products from her sales stall.  This means of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, because she lives in a common-law marriage and has 2 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the health services offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wool and fabric at wholesale

loans.name: Abdunazar

texts.ru: Абдуназар мужчина 35 лет , женат,молодой и счастливый отец троих детей . Он вырос в сельской местности и с детства занимается скотоводством.Вот уже на протяжение 12 лет Абудназар на своем участке земли занимается разведением скота.В начале у него было всего пару голов скота,но сейчас у него уже целое стадо баранов.Также у него есть 2 коровы.Молоко,полученное от дойки коров,его жена продаёт на рынке.Абдуназар понимает,что в наше время нужно иметь высшее образование ,чтобы получить хорошую работу и жить,не зная нужд.Поэтому он работает день и ночь,чтобы иметь возможность обучить своих детей.Он берет кредит,чтобы увеличить поголовье своего стада и закупить корм на зиму.Но у него нет полной суммы денег.Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Он надеется,что МДО Арванд выделит ему нужную сумму,которая даст ему возможность расширить свой бизнес.Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Abdunazar is a man of 35 years. He is married and the young and happy father of three children. He grew up in a village and since childhood he worked with livestock breeding. Abdunazar has bred the livestock on his own plot of land for a period of twelve years already. In the beginning he had only two heads of livestock, but currently he has a whole herd of rams. He also has two cows. His wife sells the milk he gets from the dairy cows on the market. 

Abdunazar understands that in our times it is necessary to have higher education in order to get good work and a good life, and not be in need of anything. Therefore he works day and night in order to have the opportunity to educate his children. 

Abdunazar takes a loan in order to increase his herd and purchase fodder for the winter season. He does not have the full amount of money for this. Therefore he turned to "MDO Arvand" for financial support. He hopes that "MDO Arvand" will lend him the necessary amount which will give him the opportunity to expand his business. He thanks in advance for the support and faith.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fodder for the winter season

loans.name: Maria Berta

texts.es: Maria de 30 años vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero desde hace 14 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona y ya tiene muchos clientes establecidos, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de una novilla para poder continuar la crianza y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria, 30, lives in her own house with her husband and her two children.  She has been raising milk cows for 14 years.  She sells her products around the area, and she already has many established customers.  Maria is requesting a loan for the purchase of a heifer so that she will be able to continue raising cows, and thus have better income.

loans.use: to purchase a heifer.

loans.name: Ana Glendi

texts.es: Ana de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 11 años, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y tiene muchos clientes, Ana esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorara el terreno que muestra la fotografía y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Ana is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her partner and daughter. She has been making a living growing corn for 11 years. She sells her products in nearby towns and she has many customers. Ana is asking for this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides and will improve the land shown in this photograph so as to earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides and to improve her land.

loans.name: Khurshida

texts.ru:
Эту молодую женщину из района Спитамен зовут Хуршида, ей 24 года. Она рано вышла замуж и родила двоих детей. Сейчас ее старшему ребенку 9 лет, а младшему 7 лет, они оба ходят в школу. Хуршида имеет высшее образование, она по профессии педагог и работает в местной школе. Муж Хуршиды является фермером и занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. 
Хуршида параллельно еще и занимается животноводством. Она у себя при  дворе дома разводит овец и баранов. Хуршида сейчас хочет закупить несколько голов скотов, так как зимой их цена ниже. В связи с этим она обратилась аз кредитом, на сумму которого собирается закупить несколько овец и баранов. Хуршида ждет поддержки.
texts.en:
This young woman from the Spitamen region is called Khurshida. She is 24 years old. She got married early and has given birth to two children. Currently her eldest child is nine years old and her youngest is seven. Both go to school. 

Khurshida has higher education. She is a teacher and works at the local school. Khurshida's husband is a farmer and works with growing crops. In parallel, Khurshida also breeds livestock. In her yard she breeds sheep and rams. 

Khurshida would currently like to purchase some livestock, as the price is lower in the winter. With this in mind she applied for a loan. She has decided to purchase some sheep and rams for the loan amount. Khurshida awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and rams to increase the number of livestock

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish pond operator business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional feed.

Mary Rose has been in this business for one year now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials, like bamboo, nails, and paint.

Meriam has been in this business for three years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials, like bamboo, nails, and paint.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 59 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Alberta works very hard to provide for them.

Alberta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, noodles, beers, etc. to sell.

Alberta has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, noodles, beers, etc. 

Alberta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, noodles, beers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Masha Group

texts.fr:
Bonaventure  fait partie du groupe  Masha et  habite à  Cibitoke. Il a 50 ans et est marié à Christine, une femme de ménage. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 3 à 16 ans, dont  4 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de la bière de banane   depuis  13 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes à  transformer en bière,   à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Bonaventure is part of the Masha Group and lives in Cibitoke. He is 60 and married to Christine, a housewife. Together they have 6 children ages 3 to 16, 4 of whom study.
He has sold banana beer for 13 years.
This is his first loan with Turame. With this loan, listed on Kiva, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to make beer for sale in order to make more money.
In the next few years, he would like to see his children study.

loans.use: to buy bananas to make beer.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a merchant from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is 55 years old, married and a mother of seven grown-up children. She runs a small sari-sari or variety store selling various goods to the people in her community. This has been the source of her income for more than two years now.
Helen is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, toiletries, rice, condiments, bread and snack foods. This loan will help her improve her inventory and attract more buyers to her store. 
In the future, Helen hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, toiletries, rice, condiments, bread and snack foods

loans.name: Nina

texts.ru:
Нина пожилая жительница района Хамадони в возрасте 66 лет. Она мирно живет в своем селе и занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью вместе с мужем. Нина многодетная мать, у нее четверо сыновей и четверо дочерей. На протяжении более 20 лет Нина и ее муж занимаются выращиванием зерновых и огородных культур.
Сейчас наступил сезон зимнего посева и их семья активно готовится к посеву нового урожая. За счет суммы кредита Нина хочет приобрести семена пшеницы и топлива для осуществления посева. Этот кредит им важен для продолжения деятельности и сохранения источника дохода.
texts.en:
Nina is an elderly resident of the Hamadoni region. She is 66 years old. She lives peacefully in her village and works with field crop cultivation together with her husband. Nina is the mother of many children. She has four sons and four daughters. 

Nina and her husband have worked with sowing cereals and vegetables for a period of more than 20 years. Currently the winter sowing season started, and the family is actively preparing for sowing new crops. With the loan amount, Nina would like to purchase wheat seeds and fuel to do the sowing. This loan is important to them to continue their business and keep their source of income.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fuel to carry out the winter sowing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy charcoal, firewood and culinary oil to resell

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru:
Назире 59 лет. Она из района Бохтар. Назира на рынке продает конфеты и сухофрукты. Она мать одиночка. У нее один сын. Для Назиры ее сын является всем. Он стимул в ее жизни и ради него она живет. 
   На данный момент у Назиры имеются проблемы со здоровьем. Ей срочно необходимо взять курс лечения. К сожалению Назира не имеет возможности полностью отплатить за свое лечение, и она вынуждена обратиться за кредитом. Назира надеется в скором времени восстановить свое здоровье, и сможет вернуться к работе.
texts.en:
Nazira is 59 years old. She is from the Bohtar region. Nazira sells candy and dried fruit at the market. She is a single mother and has one son. Her son means everything to her. He is the impetus in her life and she lives for him. 

Currently Nazira has health problems. She urgently needs to get treatment. Unfortunately Nazira does not have the opportunity to pay for her treatment in full, and she needs a loan. Nazira hopes to restore her health quickly so that she can return to her work.

loans.use: to get treatment to restore her health

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy two cows for meat.

loans.name: Hector Hugo

texts.en: Hector is married and has two children aged 12 and 3. He has been working for a transportation company for the last two years, he works as a supervisor. Hector is asking for a loan to do some improvements in his home. He says that he only asks for small loans that he knows he can afford to pay on time, but the money will be extremely helpful to do some urgent fixes in his home.

loans.use: with home improvements.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 52 years old, married and has two grownup and independent sons. She has lived in her in-laws house for more than 33 years. Her husband has a printing shop were he makes serigraphy work and she has been selling cosmetics for more than 15 years. She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to grow her sales. She says that she is proud of helping her husband with the family expenses and sending her kids to school. Her biggest achievement is gaining financial stability.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: Roberto has two different sources of income, he works as a shoe shiner and also sells fruit in the street. Roberto asked for a loan to invest in fruits to increase his sales during the end of year. This is his second loan and he payed the first one on time. He has been selling fruit for more than 25 years and started the shoe shine business two years ago.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en:
Saleem is a 34-year-old, married woman and the mother of 4 children.

In order to support her family she began the business of selling milk. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She is happily supporting her family with the income she generates.

For the growth of her business, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo.

She is hopeful that an increase in milk production will help her generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase milk production and help her generate more income.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Hazel is 44 years old and one of her children is currently in school.

Hazel has a general store business in the Philippines. Hazel requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Hazel has been in this business for three years. Hazel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 30 years old and three of her children are currently in school.

Jocelyn has a meat vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional meat to sell in her meat stall.

Jocelyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional meat to sell in her meat stall

loans.name: Juralen

texts.en:
Juralen is 31 years old and married with one child, who is currently in school. Juralen works very hard to provide for her family.

Juralen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Juralen has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, biscuits, candies, soft drinks, milk, coffee, and cooking oil. 

Juralen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. Lolita is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for three years now.

Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 58 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Anita has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Anita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make home improvements that will give her more working space to cook for her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy onions, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soap, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of four children, Vicky works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Vicky is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Maritza is married and has two small children. She works selling cosmetics and shoes through a catalog. Maritza says that she likes working and helping her husband with the family expenses.

Maritza is requesting a loan to buy more products to sell. At the end of the year, there are many requests from clients and she is able to increase her sales. In the future, Maritza’s goal is to help her kids to go to school and become independent.

loans.use: to buy shoes and cosemtics to sell

loans.name: Toktogul

texts.ru: Токтогул, 63 года, вдовец,есть сын. У Токтогула среднее образование. Он по характеру: спокойный, уравновешенный и трудолюбивый. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет Токтогул занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес много лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Токтогула, в хозяйстве имеется: 3 овцы, а также есть земельный надел мерою 0,35 ГА, на котором он выращивает картофель для реализации. Его деятельность приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь. Поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Токтогул обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 8 овец. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Toktogul is 63 years old. He is a widower and has a son. Toktogul has secondary education. As a person he is calm, balanced and hard working. 

As a main source of income for his family, Toktogul has long worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started this business many years ago. Thanks to Toktogul's persistent work, he currently has three sheep and a plot of land of 0.35 hectares on which he grows potatoes for selling. 

Toktogul's business brings in around 8,000 som (KGS) per month. This money is not enough for a decent life. Therefore, with an aim to further develop his business, Toktogul turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase eight sheep. He plans to invest the income from his loan in further developing his business.

loans.use: to purchase eight sheep in order to expand his business and increase his income

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. Lydia is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Lydia requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Lydia has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Lydia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Frangelina

texts.en: Frangelina is married and has 1 child. She has been involved in business activities since 2008. She started her business with her own working capital of $200.00. Frangelina sells a variety of items in the center of the local market, so every day she earns a good income from her business. She is taking a loan of $800.00 from Tuba Rai Metin, a Kiva Partner, to buy additional items to sell including milk, sardines, soap, shampoo, clothes brushes, batteries, toothpaste, sugar, candies, balm, toothbrushes, cooking oils, and other things. She also raises animals such as pigs, goats, and dogs for additional income.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her space at the local market.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. Myrna is married and has a direct selling of Avon products business in the Philippines.

Myrna requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products from Avon like lotion, deodorant, shampoo, body spray, etc. to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for 25 years now.

Myrna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell from Avon like lotion, deodorant, shampoo, body spray, etc.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is 62 years old and widowed with two children. 

Nerissa is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Nerissa requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

Nerissa has been raising cattle for seven years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nerissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her cattle

loans.name: Erkin

texts.ru: Эркин женщина 50 лет,замужем,мать четверых детей. Она вырастила и поставила на ноги четверых детей,работала день и ночь на нескольких работах,чтобы прокормить их и дать им всё,что требуется.Вот уже на протяжение 20 лет Эркин занимается бизнесом,продает канцелярские вещи на рынке.Торговля идет хорошо,каждый день у нее много клиентов.Но так как конкуренции много на рынке,она хочет привезти что-нибудь новое и необычное.Но для того чтобы расширить свой бизнес и закупить новый товар,ей нужна определенная сумма денег .На данный момент у нее нет полной суммы . Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Она надеется,что МДО Арванд одобрит её заявку на получение кредита и даст возможность расширить свой бизнес.Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Erkin is a 50 years old woman. She is married and the mother of four children. She has brought up and educated four children, working day and night for several years in order to feed them and give them everything they needed. 

Erkin has had a business of selling stationary items at the market for a period of 20 years. The sales are good. She has many customers every day. However, as there is a lot of competition at the market, she would like to bring in something new and unusual. 

In order to expand her business and purchase new goods, she needs a certain amount of money. Currently she does not have the full sum. Therefore she turned to "MDO Arvand" for financial support. She hopes that "MDO Arvand" approves her loan application and gives her the possibility to expand her business. She thanks for the support and faith in advance.

loans.use: to purchase stationery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products such as creams, perfumes, deodorants, lotions, shampoo, etc., in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bananas to make beer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: finalize the acquisition of a building plot

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus hijos y su esposa el posee una tienda desde hace varios años, Manuel quiere mejorar su vivienda pintando la parte de enfrente de la casa y cambiando las puertas, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para realizarlo, por eso solicita nuevamente un crédito para la compra de pintura y puertas, para que el y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en: Manuel is 39 years old and lives in his own house with his children and his wife. He has owned a shop for many years. Manuel wishes to improve his house by painting the front of the house and changing the doors. However, with what he earns, he will not be able to do this so he is requesting a new loan to buy paint and doors so he and his family can live more securely.

loans.use: to buy paint and doors.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is married and works hard to support her family. She has a used clothing business in the Philippines that she has been running for 2 years. Mercy requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers. In the future, Mercy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano vive en una comunidad de Solola, él tiene 47 años de edad, Mariano tiene una hermosa  familia de tres  hijas. 

Mariano es un hombre que le encanta trabajar la agricultura, ya que desde pequeño empezó con ese trabajo, él siembra diversidad de hortalizas pero lo que más le encanta sembrar y por la temperatura del ambiente donde vive es papa, zanahoria  y arveja, ya que estos tipos de verduras son resistentes a las heladas. 

Mariano para realizar este trabajo tiene mucho apoyo de su esposa y de sus hijas, pues con el apoyo de su familia él está buscando un préstamo para ampliar su cultivo, ya que necesita comprar semillas y otros insumos para lo que ha pensado sembrar, Mariano tiene mucha experiencia en la agricultura,  y uno de los sueños de Mariano también, es que con las ganancias que genera su cultivo pueda remodelar su vivienda para darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mariano lives in the community of Solola. He is 47 years old. Mariano has a beautiful family of three daughters.

Mariano is a man who loves agricultural work since he started this work when he was young. He plants a variety of vegetables but what he loves more and due to the ambient temperature where he lives is potato, carrot and peas since these types of vegetables are resistant to frost.

To perform this work, Mariano has a lot of support from his wife and daughters. With the support of his family, he is looking for a loan to expand his crop since he needs to buy seeds and other inputs for what he is thinking about planting. Mariano has a lot of agricultural experience and one of his dreams is that with the income his crop generates he can remodel his house to give better living conditions to his family.

loans.use: to buy seed.

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe

texts.es: Ana de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla en los diferentes mercados, Ana esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas,etc. para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: Ana, 30, lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She is dedicated to growing maize and beans. When her harvest is ready, she stores it in the barns shown in the photograph to then sell in the different markets. Ana is requesting a loan to buy seeds, organic and chemical fertilizers, pest control, etc. to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy seed, organic and chemical fertilizers, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Turagame Group

texts.fr:
Innocent  fait partie du groupe  Turagame et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 45 ans et est marié à Suzanne, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de 2 à 21 ans, dont  6 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge sa mère. 

Il fait le commerce des habits    depuis  25 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu'il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une voiture, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Innocent is part of the group Turagame and lives in Bujumbura. He is 45 years old and married to Suzanne, a farmer. Together they have seven children, from 2 to 21 years old, of whom six are students. He has his mother in his care.

Innocent has been doing commerce in clothing for 25 years. 

He is on his 2nd Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase a lot of clothing to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy a car and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of clothing to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Mallku Irpiri Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MALLKU IRPIRI” iniciará el décimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de chompas, venta de ropa interior, venta de fruta, venta de masitas, servicio de transporte, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rina es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de revistas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, ya que le ayudaba a su amiga a comercializar estos productos y con el pasar del tiempo y un pequeño capital decide emprender su propio negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de revistas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Mallku Irpiri" community bank will begin its 17th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board where Rina is the President. The businesses that the members of the community association manage are varied. Among them are: selling blankets, selling sweaters, selling underwear, selling fruit, selling "masitas" (fried food), transportation services, selling cosmetics.

The loan they will take will benefit the small businesses where Rina is a member. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling magazines. She started this business many years ago since she helped a friend sell these products and with the passage of time and a small amount of capital she decided to start her own business.

The loan that she now will take is to expand capital (to buy magazines at wholesale) that she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and later sell in her shop. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says that she likes the savings and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy magazines at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make a change in a vehicle

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica is married, and she works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jessica is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more chickens and ingredients for her food stall. Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and ingredients for her food stall.

loans.name: Aparicio Balmore

texts.es: Aparicio es un joven de 27 años de edad que se gana la vida atendiendo su molino de nixtamal, actividad que le ha permitido sostener la economía de su hogar, desde hace muchos años. Él habita en vivienda propia junto a su padre que siempre lo ha apoyado. Aparicio cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes a los que no logra dar abasto con su molino, por lo que desea comprar otro y mejorar el local de su negocio y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar un molino de nixtamal y mejorar el local de su molino lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Aparicio is a 27 year old man that earns a living working at his corn mill. This activity has allowed him support the economy of his home for many years.
He lives at home with his father who had always supported him. Aparicio has many customers that he is hardly able to serve through his mill. This is why he wants to buy another mill and improve the area where it is located. He requests a loan to FUSAI to buy a corn mill and improve his shop as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy a corn mill and improve his shop.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo de 67 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su pick up desde hace varios años, quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando piso cerámico, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para realizarlo, por eso solicita un credito para la compra de piso cerámico, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para que el su hija puedan vivir mas cómodos y en lo limpio.
texts.en: Gerardo, 67, has operated a taxi business for many years.  He owns the house where he and his daughter live and he wants to make improvements to it.  He is applying for a loan because he doesn't have enough cash to cover the costs of the improvements.  The loan will pay for the labor and materials--cement, tile, sand--that he needs for the project and ensure that he and his daughter have a decent place to live.

loans.use: to cover the costs of labor and material for improvements to his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flavored jellies, bananas, chocolate, fruit, etc. all at wholesale.

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
Menchie is 26 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, eggs, etc.

Menchie has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

Maricel has been in this business for 3 years.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Walter Orlando

texts.es: Walter de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y su hermana, el trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada, quiere mejorar su vivienda, construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para realizarlo, por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra, y asi el y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros y cómodos.
texts.en: Walter, 45, lives in his own house with his mother and his sister. He works as an employee at a private company. He wishes to improve his home, building a room in the place shown in the photo. However, with what he earns, he does not have enough to do this so he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron and to pay laborers and then he and his family can live more securely and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing for women and men at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 305 motor and two gimbals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy handbags, shoes, and tablecloths for resale

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.es:
Gaspar es un hombre casado de 45 años de edad, tiene una familia numerosa de 10 hijos de las cuales dos son mujeres y ocho varones. 

Gaspar para ganarse la vida y poder mantener a su familia, desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de comida rápida, este venta lo realiza en el lugar donde vive, la esposa de Gaspar a pesar de tanto hijos, ella busca la forma de cómo ayudar a su esposo, ella para generar un poco de ingreso para su familia, se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica, este oficio lo aprendió con su mamá desde que ella era muy pequeña. 

Gaspar su esposa siempre están a la vanguardia de su familia, la pareja ha decido buscar un préstamo para comprar un terreno y ampliar la construcción de su vivienda,  con las ganancias que generan entre los dos pagarían el préstamo, ahora cuenta con una casa pero ya no es suficiente para su familia. El sueños de estos padres es conseguir lo que están anhelando para darles una mejor comodidad a su familia
texts.en:
Gaspar is a 45 year old married man. He has a big family with 10 children, 2 daughters and 8 sons. For the last 15 years Gaspar has been selling fast food to make a living and be able to support his family. He sells at his house.

Gaspar's wife, in spite of having so many children is looking for q way to help her husband. She works making traditional clothing to bring in a bit of income for the family. She learned this from her mother when she was very young.

Gaspar and his wife are always at the front of the family. The couple has decided to get a loan to buy a lot and expand the size of their house. Between their two incomes they can pay off the loan. Currently their house is not sufficient for the family. The dream of this couple is to achieve what they have been wishing for, which is to provide more comfort for their family.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Silvia Noemy

texts.es: Silvia de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando puertas y ventas en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un credito para la compra de puertas, vidrios para ventas , balcones y pago de mano de obra, para que ella y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en: Silvia, 36, lives in her own house with her husband and their four children. She is dedicated to growing maize and beans. She wishes to improve her house, changing doors and windows shown in the photograph. But with what she earns from sales, she will not make enough to do this so for this reason she is requesting a loan to buy doors and glass for the windows, balconies and to pay laborers so she and her family can live more securely.

loans.use: to buy doors and glass for the windows, balconies and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Orzugul

texts.ru: Орзугул талантливая и опытная швея из района Масточх города Худжанд. Ей 22 года. Она еще не замужем и живет с матерью и отцом. Орзугул самостоятельная девушка и уже 5 лет как зарабатывает на жизнь путем шитья. Она шьет женские национальные одеяния и ее услуга всегда востребована. Умение шить и придумывать фасоны для платьев передано ей от матери. Орзугул с интересом относится к своей работе и хочет расширить сферу своих услуг. За счет кредита Орзугул планирует купить компьютерную швейную машинку и помимо шитья начать делать вышивку на платьях. Таким образом она расширит свое дело и увеличит количество клиентов.
texts.en: Orzugul is a talented and experienced seamstress from the Mastochkh region in the city of Khujand. She is 22 years old. She is not yet married and lives with her mother and father. Orzugul is a self-sufficient woman who has been earning her living through sewing for the past 5 years. She sews women's ethnic Tajik-style garments. Her services are always in demand. She learned how to sew and create patterns for dresses from her mother. Orzugul is very much involved with her work and wants to expand her offered services. With the loan, Orzugul plans to buy a computerized sewing machine and, in addition to sewing, begin to do embroidery on her dresses. In this way, she plans to expand her business and increase her number of customers.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine for embroidery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy candies, sodas, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, jellies, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 21,000 PHP through NWTF, in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Emelita successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Emelita's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine is 33 years old and married. She has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to purchase more items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, chips, coffee, etc. Cristine has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years, and she also earns income from food vending.

She aspires to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, chips, and coffee.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahaya would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Yahaya expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and, in the long run, move to the city with his family.

loans.use: to buy his family food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy men's shoes, women's shoes, slippers and other things to sell, including bags and blankets.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Daniel would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Daniel can now store his maize at harvest time. He can sell it a few months later, at a price up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Daniel expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide his family with food and clothing, and in the long run, to move to the city with his family.

loans.use: to buy his family food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Friday would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Friday can now store his maize at harvest time. He can sell it a few months later, at a price up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Friday expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and in the long run, to move to the city with his family.

loans.use: to buy his family food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Fatravi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FATRAVI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Betzabe es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de tucumanas, taller mecánico.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Betzabe es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de tucumanas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, aprendiendo al ayudar en la venta de su madre, posteriormente con un poco de ahorro y con la adquisición de un puesto fijo implemento su negocio propio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Fatravi community association will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board where Betzabe is the President. The businesses the members of the community association manage are varied. Among them are: selling food, neighborhood shop, selling tucumanas (food), mechanic shop.

The loan they will take will benefit the small businesses where Betzabe is a member. She indicates that this is the first time she is working with Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of an assessor of the institution who visited her house. Currently, she has a business selling tucumanas. She started this business many years ago, learning it from helping her mother with sales. Later, with some savings and the acquisition of a fixed place she started her own business.

The loan she she will now take is to expand capital (buy flour at wholesale) that she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and later make and sell in her shop. This type of work allows her to earn resources to support her family economically since she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the training and the health that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy flour at wholesale.

loans.name: Hertsel

texts.en:
Hertsel is  a 36-year-old married woman, and a mother of three children, from Concepcion, Iloilo. She runs a small restaurant or carenderia, selling home cooked foods to the people in her area. Hertsel has been in the business for more than 15 years. 
She is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients to sell, such as meat, vegetables, rice, cooking oil, condiments, and soft drinks. With the help of the loan, she will be able to cook more food, and sell it to her customers. In the future, Hertsel hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to sell, such as meat, vegetables, rice, cooking oil, condiments, and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to sewer lines.

loans.name: Takku Liguèye Médine Extension Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Takku Liguèye Médine regroupe des relais communautaires qui vivent dans le même quartier et qui ont décidé de se regrouper en groupe de crédit parce qu’ayant  des activités parallèles commerciales.
Leur présidente, la dame Ngoné Diaba, est mariée et mère d’un garçon de 16 ans. Elle s’active dans le commerce de divers : encens, pochettes, chaussures. Elle a démarré en 2005 avec un capital tiré d’une épargne personnelle, qu’elle a développé petit à petit. Avec les bénéfices, elle appuie son époux dans les charges familiales. Elle s’occupe aussi de proches qui sont à sa charge. 
Son désir le plus ardent sera de développer son commerce afin de pouvoir l’étendre à travers les gens qu’elle prend en charge chez elle.
texts.en:
The Takku Liguèye Medina lending group consists of community volunteers who live in the same neighborhood and decided to create a credit group because of their parallel commercial activities.

Their president, lady Ngoné Diaba, is married and the mother of a 16-year-old boy. She is an active trader of various items: incense, bags, shoes.

She started business in 2005 funded with her personal savings, and gradually developed her business. With the profits, she helps her husband manage family expenses. She also supports relatives who are dependents.

Her greatest desire is to develop her business so she can extend it and include the people she supports in her home.

loans.use: buy incense, shoes and clutch bags for resale

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is a married woman, and she has three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 51 years old, and two of her children are still in school.

Teofila has a direct-selling business in the Philippines; she sells Fullerlife products. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more products from Fullerlife to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Teofila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products from Fullerlife to sell to her customers.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Jose tiene una hermosa familia de 3 hijos, dos de ellos estudian en la escuelita de su comunidad, él vive muy alegre al lado de su esposa, Jose tiene 34 años de edad. 

Jose es un hombre que  tiene una visión muy clara en su vida, el tiene en su casa una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, él puso esta tienda para aprovechar uno de los espacios que tiene su casa, es una ventaja para él ya que no paga  alquiler de local, José  aparte de la tienda se dedica también a la venta y compra de diversidad de verduras. Con el apoyo de su familia la tienda está, funcionando, él se dedica al cuidado de su tienda únicamente en sus  tiempos libre. 

Jose necesita ampliar su tienda pero no cuenta con suficiente capital para hacerlo, por tal motivo él se ha puesto de acuerdo con su esposa para buscar un préstamo y poder hacer realidad este sueño, José considera que con la ampliación de su tienda el puede en el futuro seguir con la construcción de su casa, para que sus hijos tengan un lugar mejor donde vivir.
texts.en:
Jose has a beautiful family of three children, two of whom study at the community school. He lives very happily alongside his wife. Jose is 34 years old.

Jose is a man who has a very clear vision for his life. He has a small grocery shop in his house. He started this shop to take advantage of one of the spaces in his house. It is an advantage for him that he does not pay rent for the shop. As well as the shop, Jose is also dedicated to selling and buying a variety of vegetables. With the support of his family, the shop is working. He is dedicated to managing the shop only in his free time.

Jose needs to expand the shop but he does not have enough capital for this. For this reason he has agreed with his wife to look for a loan and to make his dream a reality. Jose considers that with the expansion of the shop, he can in the future continue with the construction of his house so his children have a better place to live.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 58 years old, married, and has one child. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for six years, now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF, to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to support her pineapple farming business.

loans.name: Marcos Eulofio

texts.es: Marcos de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas desde hace varios años, el quiere mejorar su vivienda realizando un encementando en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para que el y sus hijos puedan vivir mas cómodos y en lo limpio.
texts.en: Marcos, 43, has owned a metal shop for many years.  He owns his house and lives there with his three children.  He wants to lay a concrete patio in the spot that he's pointing to in the photo and is applying for a loan that he will use to cover the costs of labor and materials for carrying out the project.  The investment will make the house safer and healthier for him and his children.

loans.use: to cover the costs of labor and materials for house improvement project.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 42 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Judith works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell such as spices, sugar, chips, soft drinks, etc.

Judith has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Judith would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell such as spices, sugar, chips, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Amasare Group

texts.fr:
Vincent  fait partie du groupe  Masare et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 28 ans et est mariée à Spès, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 1 à 7 ans, dont  1 étudie.
Elle a sous sa charge son beau frère  qui étudie. 

Il fait le commerce du  riz et  du haricot,   depuis  5 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de kilos   de riz et de haricot à revendre, pour gagner plus.
 
Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une parcelle, une voiture,  devenir un importateur, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Vincent is part of the Masare group, and lives in Bujumbura. He is 28 and is married to Spès, a crop farmer. Together they have two children, one and seven years old, including one who attends school. He also has under his care his brother-in-law, who is in school.

He has been trading rice and beans for the past five years.

This is his first loan with Turame. He will use the Kiva loan to increase his working capital and buy many kilos of rice and beans for resale, to earn more.
 
In coming years, he would like to buy a building plot, a car, become an importer and ensure his children's education.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy many kilos of rice and beans for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Madalena to improve her business. She is married and has two children. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as shirts, trousers, and shorts.

She has been involved in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Madalena independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, and shorts.

loans.name: Kildare Otayme

texts.es: don Kildare de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de una vaca para seguir con la crianza y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Don Kildare, 43, and his wife own their house.  He has kept dairy cows for many years and sells what they produce to buyers in all of the nearby markets.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy a cow so that he can grow his business.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Cruz De Loza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CRUZ DE LOZA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mercedes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de artesanías, tienda de barrio, costura de mantas, venta de leche, venta de comida, tejido de mantas, venta de frutas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mercedes es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, aprendiendo al ayudar en la venta de su tía, posteriormente con un poco de ahorro y con la adquisición de un puesto fijo implemento su negocio propio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de frutas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Cruz de Loza” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a board of directors in which Sra. Mercedes is its president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling handicrafts, managing a neighborhood store, producing blankets, selling milk, selling food, weaving blankets, and selling fruit.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Mercedes. She says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined after receiving an invitation from an advisor from the organization who visited her at her home. Mercedes currently has a business of selling fruits. She is knowledgeable about this business since she learned the trade several years ago. Mercedes started out by helping her aunt with her sales business. Later on, she used a bit of her savings to acquire a permanent location for her own business.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying fruits in bulk. She acquires her products from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and then sells them from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Mercedes is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Mercedes said that she enjoys the training seminars and the health services offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy fruits in bulk.

loans.name: Bartolina Sisa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BARTOLINA SISA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Flora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: compra y venta de ganado, tienda de barrio, venta de papa, venta de zapatos, venta de ovejas.
