El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Flora es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de ganado; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, iniciando con el apoyo de sus padres, ya que ellos tienen el mismo negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Bartolina Sisa” Communal Bank will begin the second cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Patacamaya Central Office.  It is composed of eight members and directed by a board of directors, of which Señora Flora is president.  The members of the communal bank run various businesses such as buying and selling cattle, a neighborhood store, selling potatoes, selling shoes, and selling sheep.

The loan will benefit the small businesswomen, of whom Señora Flora is a member.  She says that she became a member of Pro Mujer two years ago, joining at the invitation of a loan officer for the institution who came to visit her at her home.   She has a cattle sales business.  She says that she learned the business years ago, and that she got started with the support of her parents, as they also have the same business.

She is requesting a loan to increase her capital by purchasing cattle at wholesale.  She will acquire the cattle from the wholesale vendors in her community; and after she raises them she will sell them on order.  

This form of work allows her to generate resources in order to support her family economically, as she is married with four children.

loans.use: to purchase cattle at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy snack foods, soft drinks, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatins, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides, fertilizers, and herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Zulaykhoi

texts.ru: Зулайхои проживает в городке под названием Курган-Тюбе. Она замужем и счастлива в браке. Ей 24 года. У нее один ребенок. Ребенку 1 годик. Отец ее ребенка строитель. Сама Зулайхои работает портнихой. Она занимается кройкой и шитьем женской одежды. Зулайхои любит свою работу и планирует далее развиваться в данной деятельности. Сейчас она намерена купить новую современную швейную машинку. Она считает это необходимостью, чтобы продолжить работу. Она намерена обратиться за кредитом для купли желаемой машинки.
texts.en: Zulaykhoi lives in the small town of Qurgan-Tube. She is married and has a happy marriage. She is 24 years old. She has one child who is 1 year old. The father of her child is a construction worker. Zulaykhoi works as a seamstress. She cuts patterns and sews women's clothing. Zylaykhoi loves her work and plans to further develop her business. Now she is determined to buy a new, modernized sewing machine. She considers this a necessity in order to continue her business. She is determined to take out a loan to buy this desired sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Corazon works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns  income from rice retailing.  

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She is now borrowing PHP 20000 in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Corazon hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfume, lotions, creams, and deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma makes a good living with every quarter of her coconut farm in Tangub. This is her means of supporting her family. Norma has been able to send all her children to school until they graduated and secured their own jobs.

Out of the money she has saved, Norma purchased a 2-hectare plot. Now, she wishes to plant more dwarf coconuts of a good variety so she can increase her farm's yield. However, Norma is in need of working capital.

She presented her project to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP in order to pay for the labor to clear and plow her land and plant seedlings. Norma has high hopes that her farm will have a good, high-quality yield.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to clear and plow her land and plant seedlings

loans.name: Felia María Isadora

texts.es:
EL Grupo De  Crédito La Negrita se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Felia, tiene 61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo trabaja en el Municipio local.
Doña Felia es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante, ella   tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa donde vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, pollo, carnes, pescado, entre otras cosas, sus clientes consiguen de todo por eso es que su clientela aumenta cada día más,  trabaja todos los días desde las 06h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su marido le ayuda cuando puede, lleva más de 18 años con su tienda la cual le permite salir adelante junto a su marido.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos. Esta desde el inicio en el  Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “La Negrita” meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have been recognized on a national and international level. This place is also famous for its straw hats.

Sra. Felia lives in this place. She is 61 years old, married, and has four adult children who are independent. Her husband works in the local municipality.

Doña Felia is a woman who enjoys being good at something so that she can get ahead. She has a provisions store in her house where she sells rice, sugar, oils, detergents, chicken, meats, fish, and other products. Her customers continue to get everything they need. For this reason, her clientele increases a bit more each day. Felia works every day from 6:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M. and sometimes much later. Her husband helps whenever he can. Felia has managed her store for more than 18 years and it has allowed her and her husband to move forward.

This loan will be used to restock her store with more inventory. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other products. Felia has been with her Communal Bank from the beginning and she enjoys the assistance that the loans have offered. Her dreams include continuing to press forward.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other products.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald, 36 years old, lives in Manga, Tangub City with his wife and two children. Ronald is a jeep driver; this is how he earns an income.

Unable to sustain the needs of the family, he opened a sari-sari store to generate more income. He began with selling a small inventory of canned goods, noodles, sugar and oil to his neighbors.

He joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped him in the capitalization of his sari-sari (small grocery) store in March of 2012. He became a member in good standing (MIGS), which is why he has received several loans, and all were repaid in a timely manner. Now, he is applying for 15,000 PHP to buy merchandise for his sari-sari store.

He hopes that his business will continue, so that he can give his family a better life and repair his house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his sari-sari store.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 28 years old, and is married with three children who are in school.

Corazon has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 18,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Corazon has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is a 66-year-old married mother of two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them, operating a general store in the Philippines for the past five years.

Ignacia has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as soap, bread, sugar, etc. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, bread, sugar, etc

loans.name: Momai Mahila Mandal 006 Group

texts.en:
Thirty-four-year-old Muktaben is an adept seamstress from Adipur, a small town in the Kutch district of Gujarat, in western India. She sews sari blouses, which require a great deal of skill to cut and sew, so they lend a perfect fit to her customers. She also stitches sari petticoats and pretty dresses for local women and their little daughters, who are satisfied customers who contribute to the success of her tailoring microenterprise.

Each month, Muktaben earns Rs. 7,000, matching the income her husband brings in to run their household expenses. A diligent housekeeper, she manages to save Rs. 1,000 after paying for their living expenses, her children’s schooling, and in buying raw materials like thread, buttons, etc. for her microenterprise. With her teen-aged child nearing the age of getting ready for college, and her pre-schooler having years of schooling ahead, she needs to ensure there are more savings for their education. She also wants to set aside enough to deal with medical expenses and home repair costs that may occur as she and her husband advance in age.

She wants to grow the capacity of her tailoring business. To begin with, she needs to buy a new sewing machine, which will help her improve productivity and take on more tailoring orders both from local women and small retail customers. To access the funds to buy this new sewing machine, Muktaben formed a joint liability group with three other women entrepreneurs: Takhatba wants to grow her dairy business, Paruben wants to develop her grocery store, and Daxaba also wants a sewing machine for her tailoring enterprise.

The purchase of raw materials and stock requires hefty investments, so they seek a loan of Rs. 80,000. Your loan will help Muktaben, together with her group members, to take the necessary steps and realize the full earning potential of her microenterprise. She will be able to double her income, invest an equal amount in the further growth of her small business, and also greatly increase her savings by up to Rs. 6,000 a month.

Having had to drop out of school herself, Muktaben is extremely keen on ensuring that her children receive a full education right up to college. She is grateful for this opportunity and your support in helping her achieve financial stability so she can realize this goal.

loans.use: to buy a better sewing machine and improve the output of her tailoring microenterprise.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija y su nieto, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos (pastelitos, yuca papas fritas, etc.) Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que en la comunidad donde ella reside nadie posee luz eléctrica y con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra se podrán beneficiar con su familia ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en:
Maria is 55 years old and lives in her own home along with her daughter and grandson. She sells street food such as turnovers, yucca fries, and other items.

Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy a solar lamp since the community where she lives does not have electricity. In addition, she does not earn enough to pay for this service. The lamp also serves as a charging station since it is powered by solar panels. This is useful for homes in rural areas that do not have electricity. With this purchase, Maria’s family will benefit since they will have their own source of light at night.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Ketty Maribel

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Renacer.
En este lugar vive la señora Ketty, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos  de 21, 16 y 13 años, dos de ellos estudian en colegio. Su esposo trabaja en el extranjero.
Doña Ketty es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante a base de su trabajo, ella vende ropa y productos de Avon y  Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale dos o tres veces por semana a ofrecer sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra por semanas, ella también los fines de semana prepara comida para la venta, con esto ella se gana algo extra, lleva más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo que le sirve para darles lo mejor  a su familia. 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y varios víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 6 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda de los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The El Florón area of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, has been known for many years as the city of the real "Tamarindos". This is where the members of the credit group "Renacer" meet every 15 days. This is where 41-year-old Ketty lives. She is married and has three children from this marriage, ages 21, 16 and 13. Two of them are in high school. Her husband works abroad. 

Ketty is a woman who likes to get ahead through work. She sells clothing as well as Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She goes door-to-door selling and she does this two or three times a week to offer her products which she allows to be bought on credit and charged every week. On weekends, she also makes food to sell, which is how she earns a little extra. She's done this for over 10 years which is how she provides for her family.

This loan will be used to buy clothing, perfumes, lotion and various supplies to prepare her dishes. She's been part of the credit group for six years and she likes it because of the help she receives from the loans. Her dream is to have a great restaurant.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, lotion and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, iron, and sand and to pay for the labor.

loans.name: Marterisa

texts.en:
Marterisa is a 30-year-old married woman with two children, who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marterisa has an electronic mobile load retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional amount of electronic mobile load to sell.

Marterisa has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional amount of electronic mobile load to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 56 years old and has five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, sugar, etc.

Lydia has borrowed and paid off 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Lydia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, sugar, etc

loans.name: Alexey

texts.ru: Алексей частный предприниматель, сельским хозяйством занимается уже на протяжении 28-ми лет, В семье Алексея есть двое детей дочь 27 лет и сын 21 год. На земле площадью 3 га, выращивает картошку, сою, ячмень. Для того чтобы не брать технику в оренду Алексей с супругой решил приобрести трактор, для своевременной обработки почвы и выполнения технологических процессов. Так же Алексей предоставляет ветеринарные услуги в своем селе. В планах на будущее выращивать кукурузу, сою, ячмень. Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования минитрактора
texts.en: Alexey is a self-employed entrepreneur. He has been practicing agriculture for the past 28 years. In his family, Alexey has two children - a 27-year-old daughter and a 21-year-old son. On a 3 hectare plot of land he grows potatoes, soybeans and barley. So that he doesn't have to rent equipment, Alexey and his wife decided to purchase a tractor to till the land on time and finish the technical processes. Alexey also offers veterinary services in his village. He plans to grow corn, soy beans and barley in the future. He requires your assistance to finance the purchase of his compact tractor.

loans.use: to purchase a compact tractor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn in bulk and lime powder.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She runs a small sari-sari or grocery store. This has been her source of income for the past 9 years now. Janet is a very hardworking woman. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like rice. noodles, bread and snack foods, biscuits, canned goods, soap and detergents. With a loan, Janet will be able to improve her stock thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. 

In the future, Janet hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like rice, noodles, bread and snack foods, biscuits, canned goods, soap and detergents.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
In 2010, Victoria learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives to start-ups. Victoria tried her luck on starting a business focusing on her farming activities. 

She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Victoria borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost for a greater harvest and to support the financial needs of her children. This will give her farming income a big boost. 

Victoria looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in a position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 48-years-old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is single with no dependents.

Arlyn earns income from his own convenience store, eatery and refreshment and lodging house businesses. He has managed these businesses for 15 years already and earns approximately PHP 30,000 each month doing this type of work. At the present time, he is also an elected Barangay Official in his community.

He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of groceries and consumable products for his existing grocery store and refreshment shop. Arlyn has been a member of PMPC for 1 year already.

In the future, Arlyn hopes to renovate and expand his grocery and refreshment shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries and consumable products.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina has been preparing for the post harvest operations of her corn business in Sumirap, Tangub City. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the shelling, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and requested a loan.

Gina hopes to see all her children finish their degree and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post harvest operations

loans.name: Clementino

texts.en:
Clementino is 53 years old and lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with 3 school-age children. He has been a farmer for 10 years and he enjoys this activity. 

He requested a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizers to make his rice growth healthy and away from insects. He has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Clementino hopes that he can supply the daily needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizers.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is 39 years old and married with three children.  She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Valentine has been into pig fattening for 20 years now and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Valentine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sharifamo

texts.ru: Женщину на фотографии зовут Шарифамо. Ей 42 лет. Она проживает в городе Душанбе. Она замужем. Шарифамо нигде не работает и сидит дома. Шарифамо хочет принести пользу и тоже начать зарабатывать. Она умеет кроить и шить таджикские национальные платья. Она решила заработать на этом и начать принимать заказы на шитье женской одежды. Она имеет достаточный опыт, но нет оборудование и материалов, то есть ей необходимо купить швейную машинку и ткани. Так как у нее нет достаточно денег, она обратилась за кредитом. И просит поддержать ее.
texts.en: The woman in this photograph is named Sharifamo. She is 42 years old. She lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is married. Sharifamo does not work anywhere and remains at home. Sharifamo wants to be helpful and begin to earn money. She knows how to cut patterns and sew traditional Tajik dresses. She decided to make a living from this and begin taking orders for sewing women's clothing. She has sufficient experience but does not have the tools or materials. She needs to buy a sewing machine and fabric. As she does not have enough money, she requested a loan. She is asking you to support her.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric to start her new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement and sand and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The young woman whose face has been pixelated, because she is 24 years old and lives in a high risk zone, has worked for a number of years making and selling tortillas. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers.  The young woman lives in her own house with her husband. She is asking for a loan to purchase corn by the quintal [approximately 100 pounds] and lime powder to be able to continue making the tortillas and in this way be able to have more income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn by the quintal [approximately 100 pounds] and lime powder.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 6 años a la agricultura(siembra maíz)y al crianza de ganado,comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el solicitando un crédito para la compra de dos novillos para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young man whose face has been pixelated, because he is 25 years old and lives in a high risk zone, has worked for 6 years in agriculture (growing corn) and raising livestock. He sells his products in the different markets that are near his house.  He lives in his own house with his family. He is asking for a loan to purchase two steers to be able to continue with his work and have more income.

loans.use: to purchase two steers.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.en:
Paulino is 27 years old and single. He lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. For the past two years, Paulino has been a farmer. He earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month and is a new member of PMPC. 

He is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, Paulino hopes to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
In the year 2011, Pablita learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it extends. As a farmer in Mahayag, Molave, she tried her luck and took out a loan to start her rice production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. 

To this day, Pablita feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. Recently, she got a loan to purchase farm supplies and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Pablita wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for farm supplies and 2 sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GENESIS” iniciará el décimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margarita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, tienda de ferretería, venta de comida, venta de hamburguesas, venta de comida, servicio de construcción, taller de cerrajería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margarita es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de cerrajería; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, aprendiendo al ayudar en la venta de su familia, posteriormente con un poco de ahorro y con la adquisición de una tienda implemento su negocio propio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fierros por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente  a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Genesis” Communal Bank will begin its thirteenth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch Regional Office.  It is composed of eight members, and led by a board of directors of which Señora Margarita is president.  The members of the communal bank run various businesses, such as a clothing-sales business, a hardware store, a food-sales business, a hamburger-sales business, a construction-service, and a locksmith shop.

The loan will benefit the small businesswomen of whom Señora Margarita is a member.  She says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for five years, joining at the invitation of an advisor who came to visit her at her home. She has a locksmith shop.  She says that she learned the business years ago, learning by helping her family with sales.  Later, with a little savings and the acquisition of a store, she started her own business.

The loan that she will take out now is for increasing capital through the purchase of wholesale iron, which she will acquire from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz.  After fabrication, she will sell on customer order.  This form of work allows her to generate resources for supporting her family, as she is married with four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training and the health care that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale iron.

loans.name: La Cosecha Del Señor Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNA LA COSECHA DEL SEÑOR ESTA CONFORMADA POR NUEVE INTEGRANTES, OCHO MUJERES Y UN HOMBRE, PADRES  Y MADRES RESPONSABLES CON QUINCE HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DE MALPAISILLO, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDO CURSAR SUS ESTUDIOS Y SE VIERON EN LA OBLIGACIÓN DE TRABAJAR A TEMPRANA EDAD PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.
EN LA ACTUALIDAD LA COORDINADORA ES  CONCEPCIÓN Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA LA VENTA MARISCO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN Y DE FORMA AMBULANTE, LA RUTINA DE TRABAJA ES DE UNAS DIEZ HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SU PRODUCTO COMO: PESCADO, CAMARONES, PUNCHES, JAIBA, ETC. A CLIENTES FIJOS Y EVENTUALES. EL OBJETIVO ES INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE  MARISCO PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. LA COSECHA DEL SEÑOR AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The communal association "La Cosecha del Señor" is made up of nine members, eight women and one man who are mothers and fathers responsible for 15 children. They are from Malpaisillo and are characterized as being hardworking and responsible, with the desire to better themselves. Unfortunately they lack the economic resources and couldn't go to school, but instead had to go to work at a young age to help with the household expenses. 

Currently, Concepción is the coordinator and she works selling seafood from her home and as a street vendor. She works 10 hours a day offering her products such as: fish, shrimp, crab, etc. to established customers and possible ones. Her objective is to invest in the purchase of seafood so that in the near future she'll be able to earn a better income. 

"La Cosecha del Señor" is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to people lacking resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have decent work.

loans.use: to buy and sell seafood such as: fish, shrimp and crab.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business of selling dried fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers. In the future, Encarnacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling Christmas decorations and dry goods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Gina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials and dry goods for her business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and dry goods for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 50 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks and other products to sell. Elizabeth has been in this business for 5 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks and other products to sell

loans.name: Luvisminda

texts.en:
Luvisminda works hard to support her family. Luvisminda is married and has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 28 years now.

Luvisminda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

In the future, Luvisminda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven que vela también, por las necesidades que afrontan sus padres, él tiene 20 años de edad, soltero vive junto a sus padres, en una comunidad de Solola.

Jorge es un muchacho muy  trabajador y colaborador con su familia, él a pesar de ser joven, le gusta apoyar a su papá en lo que pueda, él hace un año instalo un café internet en su comunidad, es ahí donde trabaja ahora, pero para Jorge no es  suficiente este trabajo para generar ingresos, en el café trabajo de lunes a viernes y el fin de semana trabaja  para una librería.  
 
Jorge con los dos ingresos que genera, le hablo un día a su padre viendo lo que hace falta en su hogar, él  vio que una de las necesidades de fuerza mayor es  la remodelación de su vivienda. Jorge le propuso a su padre en conseguir un préstamo para comprar materiales e  insumos para empezar con los trabajos de remodelación  y que él se encargaría de pagarlo, poco a poco, con el visto bueno de su padre él está ahora con las expectativas de conseguir un crédito. 

El es muy joven pero siempre piensa en su futuro los sueños de este joven es lograr el préstamo y esto sería un reto para él en seguir trabajando duro para poder realizar sus pago.
texts.en:
Jorge is a young man who takes care of things also, due to the needs his parents face. He is 20 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the community of Solola. 

Jorge is a hard-working young man and helps his family. Despite being young, he likes to support his father as he is able. A year ago, he established an internet café in his community. He works there now, but for Jorge this work is not enough to generate income. He works in the café from Monday to Friday and on the weekends, he works for a bookstore. 

Jorge, with the two incomes that he generates, talked with his father one day, seeing that things are lacking in their home. He saw that one of the biggest needs was to remodel the house. Jorge suggested to his father that he could get a loan to purchase materials and supplies to start with the remodeling work and that he would take responsibility for paying it, little by little. With his father's approval, he is now hoping to get this loan.  

He is very young but always thinking of his future. This young man's dream is to be able to get the loan and this will be a challenge for him to continue working hard to be able to pay it off.

loans.use: to purchase materials to remodel his house.

loans.name: Jesus Eugenia

texts.es: Jesús es una mujer de 32 años de edad que se gana la vida con su chalet en el cual vende platillos típicos, bebidas frías y calientes, etc. Además vende lociones y ropa para tener mejores ingresos económicos. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 8 años de edad a la que ha logrado sacar adelante como madre soltera. Jesús desea mejorar la infraestructura del chalet y ampliar su venta de lociones y ropa y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ropa, lociones y materiales para mejorar su chalet lo antes posible y así aprovechar la época navideña y tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Jesús is a 32-year-old woman who makes a living from her chalet in which she sells typical dishes such as cold and hold drinks, etc. She also sells lotion and clothing to earn more money. She lives in her own home with her 8-year-old daughter who she has succeeded in raising as a single mother. Jesús would like to improve the infrastructure of her chalet and increase her lotion and clothing sales. This is why she's asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in: clothing, lotion and materials to improve her chalet as soon as possible so she can take advantage of the holiday season and earn a better income.

loans.use: to invest in: clothing, lotion and materials to improve her house.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could avail herself of financial assistance for her chosen business.

Cirila has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans, and all were paid in a timely manner.

Recently, she accessed a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Cirila wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo vive en una de las comunidades de  Sololá el es casado de 54 años de edad  junto a su esposa y sus 11 hijos dentro de ellos 6 son menores de edad que aun están bajo la responsabilidad del padre. 

Pablo es un hombre que lucha cada día para sacar adelante a su familia, la expectativa es seguir apoyando a sus hijos a que sigan estudiante hasta llegar hacer profesionales, Pablo por le extrema pobreza de su padre no tuvo la oportunidad de estudia tan siquiera un día en la escuela. 
Pablo trabajo como Peón en la municipalidad donde vive, pero por tener una familia muy numerosa,  le ha sido difícil  terminar de construir su casa, pues ahora que ya solo le quedan 6  hijos bajo su responsabilidad, decidió con su esposa solicitar un préstamo para culminar  la construcción. La meta de pablo y los sueños es disfrutar su casa dentro de poco tiempo. El préstamo le serviría para comprar materiales y pago de mano de obra del albañil. Pablo espera conseguir el préstamo.
texts.en:
Pablo lives in one of the communities of Sololá. He is married, 54 years old, and with his wife has 11 children, of whom 6 are minors who are still in his responsibility.  

Pablo is a man who fights each day to get his family ahead. His hope is to continue supporting his children so that they continue studying until they are professionals. Pablo, due to his father's extreme poverty, didn't have the opportunity to go to school even for one day. 

Pablo works as a laborer in the municipality where he lives, but due to having a very large family, it has been difficult to finish the construction on his house. Since he now only has 6 children in his responsibility, he decided with his wife to ask for a loan to finish the construction. Pablo's goal and his dream is to enjoy his house within a short period of time. The loan will be used to purchase materials and pay the bricklayer. Pablo hopes to get this loan.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is 50 years old and married.  She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 12 years now. 
She has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Cornelia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Darlie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ma. Darlie works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ma. Darlie is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Darlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell peanuts business in the Philippines.

Conchita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell.

Conchita has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, Conchita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy groceries and other supplies she needs in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her livelihood more if she can borrow an amount of 50,000 PHP again. This new loan will go to the maintenance of her ornamental business. She will buy gardening materials like wire, baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family with this assistance.

Carmelita wants to continue to operate her business in the coming years and she desires to have a wider and greener ornamental farm. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and garden inputs for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal ya que le ha ido muy bien en los últimos meses y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman whose face has been pixelated, as she is 26 years old and lives in a high-risk area, works selling tortillas. She lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. She is requesting a new loan to buy corn by the quintal (100 kg) and lime, as she has done very well in the last months. This would allow her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, brick, sand, and iron; and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Ermis

texts.es: Doña de Ermis de 44 años de edad se dedica la venta de productos de uso personal, ella vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de construir los cuartos en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, por eso solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para compra piso cerámico, puertas, balcones, laminas, polines, cemento y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos.
texts.en: Ermis is 44 years old and works selling personal care products. She lives in her own house with her family. She wants to improve her house, finishing the construction of the rooms in the place shown in the photograph. For this reason, she asks INTEGRAL for a loan to purchase ceramic flooring, doors, window bars, metal sheeting, beams, and cement and to pay labor costs so that she and her family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase ceramic flooring, doors, window bars, metal sheeting, beams, and cement, and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Cidel Marie

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Cidel Marie works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling bamboo business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising livestock. Cidel Marie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of bamboo to sell.

Cidel Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bamboo to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in purchases of rice, beans, sugar, and corn to sell.

loans.name: Mushkiniso

texts.ru:
Мушкинисо 43 года. Она живет в одном из сел района Фархор с мужем, 6-ми детьми, и двумя внуками. У нее очень большая и дружная семья. Мушкинисо любит свою семью и старается ради их благополучия. Шесть лет назад она открыла свой бизнес в сфере животноводства. До того времени она нигде не работала. Но жизнь заставила ее начать зарабатывать, чтобы улучшить в семье финансовые обстоятельства. Мушкинисо у своей соседки научилась всем тонкостям бизнеса откорм-продажа скотов и сейчас у нее у самой хороший опыт в этом деле. Сыновья помогают матери в деле, они выносят скот каждый день на пастбища.
В связи с тем, что в зимний период цена на скот падает, Мушикинисо хотела бы воспользоваться и увеличить поголовье своих скотов, чтобы в будущем получить хорошую прибыль от деятельности. Однако для реализации этой цели у нее нет достаточных средств, поэтому Мушкинисо обратилась за кредитом. Она надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Mushkiniso is 43 years old. She lives in one of the villages in the Farkhor District with her husband, six children and two grandchildren. Mushkiniso loves her family and works hard for their wellbeing. Six years ago, she opened her own business in the sphere of livestock breeding. Before that, she had never worked anywhere. But life forced her to start earning money so that she could improve her family's financial circumstances. Mushkiniso learned from her neighbor all of the intricacies of fattening up and reselling cattle. Now, she has a lot of experience in this trade. Her sons help her with her business - they bring the cattle out to pasture every day.

In connection with the fact that the price of cattle falls during the winter, Mushkiniso would like to use this to her advantage and increase the size of her herd. This will allow her to earn a good profit from her business in the future. However, she does not have enough money to accomplish this goal, which is why she requested a loan. She relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy several heads of cattle.

loans.name: Charie

texts.en:
Charie is a 28-year-old married mother of three children, two of whom are in school. Working hard to provide for her family, she has been running a general store in the Philippines for four years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Charie has borrowed and repaid three previous loans from NWTF and is now requesting a new one for PHP 16000 to buy more groceries to sell. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Virgita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Virgita works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a motorcycle transport business.  Virgita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish for her dried fish making business.

Virgita has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 47 years old and married with three children, two in school. Wilma works very hard to provide for her family.

Wilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy canned goods, candies, biscuits, juice, coffee, detergent soap, noodles, etc. to sell.

Wilma has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, candies, biscuits, juice, coffee, detergent soap, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is married and works hard to support her family. Elena has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vegetables to sell.

Elena has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Elena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 27 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Mary Jane has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 42 years old and married with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Annie has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

Annie has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a 57-year-old, married mother of six children, one still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Alicia has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of used clothing to sell.

Alicia has been in this business for five years. Alicia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Ma. Gemini

texts.en:
Ma. Gemini is 41 years old and a married mother of four children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Ma. Gemini has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Gemini requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Ma. Gemini has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Ma. Gemini would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: La Buena Amistad Group

texts.es: Maria  es una mujer de 56 años de edad,casada y madre de 7 hijos ya mayores, se dedica  8 horas diarias a la venta de productos de primera necesidad desde hace tres años, sus principales cliente son sus vecinos y amigos,Maria esta muy feliz de poder pertenecer al grupo La Buena Amistad"por que ha conocido a gente buena y hay mucha comprensión entre todos y sobre todo contar con el crédito que le otorga Edaprospo por que ha podido vencer muchos obstáculos ya que el dinero que ganaba su esposo no les alcanzaban y es así que ella decide emprender su propio negocio,Maria agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada y dice que no se arrepentirán, que sabrá aprovechar al máximo el préstamo para hacer su sueño realidad y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is a 56-year old woman who is married and has 7 grown-up children. She spends 8 hours daily selling basic products. She has been in the business for 3 years and her main clients are her neighbors and friends. Maria is happy to be a member of the group La Buena Amistad because she has met nice people and there is a lot of understanding among them. Also, counting on the loan from Edaprospo has helped her to overcome many obstacles as her husband's income was not enough to cover household expenses. 

Maria is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support and says that they will not regret helping her. She will make the most of the loan to make her dream come true and to reach a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic products, such as oil, rice, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Charito Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Renacer.
En este lugar vive la señora Charito, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos, uno  mayor de edad y otro de 10 años el cual estudia en escuela. Su esposo es cerrajero. Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad.
Doña Charito con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, aunque  lo que más le gusta elaborar es ropa de mujer o de niñas ya que hay mas diseños y con estos aprende aun mas, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y en temporadas también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Lleva más de 10 años con esta actividad.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva 4 ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son terminar su casa.
texts.en:
In the Floron district of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi known for many years as the city of real tamarinds, the credit group "Reborn" meets every 15 days.

In this place is where Charito lives, she is 42, married with two children, an adult and a 10 year old that is in school.  Her husband is a locksmith.  Several years ago she learned dressmaking in a local academy. 

Hoping to earn her own income and take advantage of her dressmaking skills she opened a sewing shop at her house.  There she makes clothing for women, men and children.  What she likes to make the most is women or girls clothing because there are more designs available and by making them she learns even more.  She works based on requests from individuals and during seasons she also makes uniforms for institutions, schools and colleges of the area.  She has 10 years of experience in this activity.

This new loan will be used to buy fabric and other materials for dressmaking.  She has 4 cycles with Grupo de Credito and likes the help she gets from the loans. Her dream is to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other materials for sewing.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 27 years old. He is married and together with his spouse has been blessed with one child, two years old. Robert runs a hotel business, which he has operated for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

Robert has requested his first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 20,000, which he will use add float for the money transfer business, and to purchase phone sim cards and credit cards of different values for his customers.

With the anticipated profits, Robert will be able to open a business for his wife. His hope and dream for the future is to become self-sufficient.

loans.use: to purchase phone sim cards and credit cards, and to add float for the money transfer business.

loans.name: Fannice's Group

texts.en:
Fannice is a 64-year-old proud mother of 6 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and she is representing her group of 8 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Fannice has noticed that she has learnt a lot from her farming training.

Fannice described her harvest as good last year, but she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, the 8 farmers in Fannice’s Group will be able to plant a total of 3.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Buenvenida

texts.en:
Buenvenida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling peanuts in the Philippines. In the picture, Buenvenida is posing with her daughter.

She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell for her business of buying and selling peanuts.  Buenvenida has been in this business for 2 years, and she earns more income from raising livestock.

Buenvenida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 58 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. Elsie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, chips, eggs, canned goods, etc. Elsie has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Elsie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, chips, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Melanie works hard to support her family. She has a bicycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  

Melanie is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and other materials to use with her bicycle transportation business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and other materials

loans.name: Norbita

texts.en:
Norbita is 46 years old and married. Norbita works very hard to provide for her family.

Norbita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like detergent soap, fabric conditioners, shampoo, noodles, chocolate drinks, cereals, sanitary pads, etc., to sell.

Norbita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items, such as detergent soap, fabric conditioners, shampoo, noodles, chocolate drinks, cereals, sanitary pads, etc. 

Norbita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like detergent soap, fabric conditioners, shampoo, noodles, chocolate drinks, cereals, sanitary pads, etc., to sell

loans.name: Dyline

texts.en:
Dyline is 33 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, chips, bread, etc.

Dyline has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and earns additional income from fishing.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, chips, bread, etc

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old, married and has six children. She has been a farmer for eight years. She heads Rose's Group, which consists of 11 farmers in Kakamega South District. 

Rose likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. Rose plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

Rose’s Group requested a loan, which they will use to cultivate 5.75 acres of land and purchase six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is married and has two children. To pay rent, she works in a grocery store. Her husband works in the public transportation business. 

Catalina wants to open her own business, so she is requesting a loan to establish a grocery store, In the future, Catalina would like to own a house. She hopes that you can help her.

loans.use: to open her own grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen, age 42 is a married woman with four children. The man shown in the photo is her husband who deals in the business of manufacturing watches. He also provides repair facilities to his customers. He has been doing this for many years and has become famous in their community.

For the improvement her husband business, Yasmeen has requested a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR. She wants to buy good quality plastic, metal and stainless steel material for her husband's business so he can increase production to increase his sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy good quality plastic, metal and stainless steel materials for more production to increase sales and profits.

loans.name: Shaista

texts.en:
Shaista is 46 years of age. Her great skill in hand embroidery and 8 years experience in this field has given her a very good reputation in her community. Over time, the demand for her hand embroidered cloth has grown and she uses the income generated to pay for the expenses of her 3 children.

Shaista has now requested a Murabaha loan of 30000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper to meet customers’ demands on time so she can earn good income.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper to meet customers’ demands on time so she can earn a good income.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 52-year-old, married woman.

One of her sons is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to change the engine of his van as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work. That is why Nasreen has requested a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR for her son, who wants to buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers.

Nasreen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her son's van to provide better facilities to customers.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Jose es un muchacho muy joven se junto de muy temprana edad, el vive en una de las comunidades de Solola, tiene 21 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija. 

José es un hombre que trabaja como jornalero con los vecinos de su comunidad y lugares circunvecinos,  realizando todo tipo de trabajo que se le encomienda, con este trabajo el genera los gastos para su familia,  José que ahora forma una familia se le presenta la necesidad de construir su propia casa, pero no cuenta con capital para hacer. Pues con el apoyo de su apoyo están buscando un préstamo para empezar comprar materiales y poco a poco construirán su casa.

José  le está poniendo empeño, a su trabajo para que cuando tenga el préstamo  él esté en condiciones de pagarlo, la meta de Jose para este año es empezar a construir, ya que su familia necesita de un hogar. Los sueños de José es que en poco tiempo pueda tener un lugar donde descansar.
texts.en:
Jose is a young man who got married at a young age. He lives in one of the communities of Solola with his wife and their small daughter.

Jose works as a day laborer with his neighbors in the community and the surrounding area. He does all types of work that he’s assigned. With this work, he earns income for his family. Now that Jose has a family, he has found the need to build his own house, but he doesn’t have the capital to do it. He is looking for a loan to start buying materials so he can build a house little by little.

Jose is putting in effort at his job so that when he has this loan, he will be in a position to pay it. Jose’s goal for the year is to start building because his family needs a home. Jose’s dream is to have a place where he can rest soon.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Muluki

texts.en:
Muluki runs a hotel business in Kitengela town. She has worked hard in her business for the past eigth years and she has been able to support her family. She is 52 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with three schooling children. 

She has requested for a loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock of flour, sugar, cooking oil and cereals for use in her business. This will enable her to serve more customers and make more income which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

This is her first loan term and her future hopes are to be successful and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, cooking oil and cereals.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she can improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 10,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of accessories and spare parts for their tricycle. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family if the unit is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Virginia wants to purchase another unit of tricycle. She is hoping to give her family a prosperous life someday. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita works hard to support her family. Anita is married and has a buy and sell of peanuts business in the Philippines.

Anita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell to her customers.

Anita has been in this business for 15 years now.

Anita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell to her customers

loans.name: Necia

texts.en: Necia is married and works hard to support her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She also earns additional income by operating a restaurant. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 from NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store. Necia has sustained her business through twelve prior loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by selling fish in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 30,000 from NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. She has been in this business for six years, and earns additional income by running a general store. Elizabeth has sustained her business activities through her own hard work with the help of the loans from NWTF, and dreams of expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Sarah Jane

texts.en:
Sarah Jane is 45 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school.

Sarah Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Sarah Jane has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional n income from raising livestock and retailing rice businesses.

Sarah Jane aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hamon's Group

texts.en:
Hamon, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District. He is 60 years old, married and has 5 children.

Hamon likes to think of himself as a very experienced farmer. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wants to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has learnt a lot from his farming trainings. Hamon plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Hamon’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.75 acres of land.  With this loan, the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Leonida's Group

texts.en:
Leonida is 42 years old and has 8 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Leonida has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Leonida also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Leonida's Group will be able to receive a total of 8 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Glady's Group

texts.en:
Gladys is 58 years old and has six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing her group of 14 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Gladys has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Gladys described her harvest as good last year but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to be purchasing a solar light in addition to fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Gladys’s Group will be able to plant a total of five acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Leonidah's Group

texts.en:
Leonidah is 51 years old and has 6 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Leonidah has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Leonidah also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Leonidah's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph, a 40-year-old proud father of seven children, is often described as a very hardworking individual. He is the leader of his group of 13 farmers in Teso District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Joseph has been able to consistently feed his family.

Joseph described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

Joseph is also very excited to be purchasing a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to provide light so his children can study in the evening. 

With this loan, Joseph’s Group will be able to plant a total of five acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jacklyne's Group

texts.en:
Jacklyne is a 40-year-old proud mother of 7 children. She is the group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Jacklyne has noticed that she has learned a lot from farming training.

Jacklyne described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Jacklyne’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith is 38 years old and has 6 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group, which is made up of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Judith has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to send her children to school.

Although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Judith also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan. She is very excited about it, as it will allow her to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Judith's Group will be able to receive a total of 4 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to cultivate a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-effective hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
Rose, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 16 farmers in Kakamega South District. She is 42 years old, is married and has 5 children.

Rose likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. Rose plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Rose’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 9 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve maize harvests

loans.name: Caleb's Group

texts.en:
Caleb, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing his group, formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Caleb joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to gain leadership skills. He is married and has 4 children.

With a portion of this loan, Caleb will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of his loan means that he will now be able to have light during the dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Caleb plans to use the profits he gains this year to send his children to school.

In total, Caleb’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to cultivate 5.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-effective maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Everlyne, pictured above, has been a farmer for 19 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District. She is 38 years old, is married and has 5 children.

Everlyne likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills.
