She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. Everlyne plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Everlyne’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.5 acres of land. Some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan; the group will receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve maize harvests

loans.name: James's Group

texts.en:
"James is 35 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. He has 4 children and is married. As a group leader, James is representing his group of 9 farmers in Butere District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with the One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join the One Acre Fund was largely a result of James's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to repair his home.

James and his group will receive a total of 8 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 3.5 acres."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Tsuma's Group

texts.en:
Tsuma, pictured above, is 45 years old, married, and has seven children. She has been a farmer for 15 years and is proud to represent her group of 10 farmers in Butere District. 

Tsuma likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has a larger farm group support. Tsuma plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a cow.

In total, Tsuma’s Group will use the loan to purchase inputs to cultivate five acres of land and six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvest of maize

loans.name: James' Group

texts.en:
James, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing his group, formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. He joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wants to help more farmers. He is married and has 6 children.

With a portion of this loan, James will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of his loan means that now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. James plans to use the profits he gains this year to send his children to school.

In total James’s Group will use the inputs received through this loan to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Linet's Group

texts.en:
Linet, pictured above, is 45 years old, married, and has five children. She has been a farmer for 15 years. She represents her group of 13 farmers in Webuye District. 

Linet likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. Linet plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Linet’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8.25 acres of land and will purchase 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Anjira's Group

texts.en:
Anjira's Group consists of 10 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Anjira, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 48 years old, married, and has four children. Anjira has been a farmer for 10 years and is referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Anjira joined One Acre Fund in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has learned a lot from farming trainings.  This year, Anjira will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of the loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Anjira's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, hybrid seeds, and fertilizer

loans.name: Roselland's Group

texts.en:
"Roselland, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 16 farmers in Butere District. She is 42 years old, is married and has 6 children.

Roselland likes to think of herself as a very experienced farmer. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. Roselland plans to use the profits from this coming season to repair her home.

In total, Roselland’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 9 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 9 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Phanice's Group

texts.en:
Phanice, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 14 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011, and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Phanice will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Phanice plans to use the profits she gains this year to buy a cow.

In total, Phanice’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: George's Group

texts.en:
George, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years. This 62-year-old married father of six is now proud to represent his group of 10 farmers in Butere District.

George likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. George plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a cow.

In total, George’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate five acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of four solar lights

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Everlyne has six children and is described as a very friendly person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader. She is representing her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time.

Everlyne has been a farmer for 15 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Everlyne is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 6.25 acres will be planted by Everlyne's Group and they will receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Xaviour's Group

texts.en:
Xaviour is 26 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. He has 3 children and is married. As a group leader, Xaviour is representing his group of 16 farmers in Teso District in Kenya and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Xaviour's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

Xaviour and his group will receive a total of 13 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 8 acres.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Miriam's Group

texts.en:
Miriam, pictured above, has 6 children and is always described as a very friendly person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Miriam is representing her group of 13 farmers in Matete District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Miriam has been a farmer for 16 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Miriam is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 6 acres will be planted by Miriam's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Charles's Group

texts.en:
Charles is 65 years old and has 8 children. He is the group leader and is representing his group formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Charles has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Charles also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Charles's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman and has two kids who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

Eunice has operated a tailoring business for the past 6 years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase cloth, materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a married woman with 11 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lilia is 56 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Lilia has a general store business in the Philippines. Lilia requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Lilia has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 43-year-old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family.

He wants to change the engine of his van as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work. That is why Yasmeen has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for her husband, who will buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers.

Yasmeen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her husband's van so he can provide better facilities to his customers.

loans.name: Chan Zaiba

texts.en:
Fifty-six year old Chan Zaiba is a married woman with 6 children. One of her sons, also shown in the photo, is a rickshaw driver. He has been providing transportation facilities for about 5 years to contribute to the family income.

For the improvement of her son’s business, Chan Zaiba has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for replacing the rickshaw's tires and auto body in order to provide better services to earn good profits.

loans.use: to replace her son's rickshaw's tires and auto body in order to provide better services and earn good profits.

loans.name: Aleda

texts.en:
Aleda is 44 years old and married with one child in school. Aleda works very hard to provide for them.

Aleda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.  She has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Aleda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel vive en una de las comunidades de Solola, tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a sus 4 hijos y su esposa. Sus cuatro hijos son estudiantes.

Manuel es un hombre que trabaja en la agricultura desde hace mas de 15 años, el cultiva diversidad de hortalizas, y lo hace dentro del lugar donde vive, para Manuel no es suficiente la agricultura para mantener a su familia, pues  en sus tiempos libres también se  dedica a la albañilería este trabajo lo realiza en los lugares circunvecinos. Manuel es un hombre que le gusta prosperar en la vida, para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 

Para este año Manuel necesita  incrementar su siembra, pero no cuenta con suficiente capital de trabajo, es por eso que Manuel ha tomado la decisión de buscar un préstamo, para comprar insumos agrícolas, ya que él quiere aprovechar los primeros cinco meses del año, para tener mejores cosechas porque es tiempo de verano, ya a partir del mes mayo la siembra va disminuyendo, porque ya entra el invierno.  Para Manuel conseguir el préstamo  ahora seria genial ya que así aprovecharía al máximo el tiempo para empezar a sembrar.
texts.en:
42-year old Manuel lives in one of the communities of Solala with his wife and four school-aged children. He has been a farmer for 15 years and grows a variety of vegetables near his home. However, farming does not provide sufficient income for Manuel to support his family so in his spare time he also works in construction in the surrounding area. He is the kind of man who wants to do well in life so he can provide his children with a better future.

This year Manuel needs to plant more crops but he doesn’t have enough money to do this, so he has decided to seek a loan to buy agricultural supplies. He wishes to take advantage of the first five months of the year which are the summer months. From May onwards the harvest is less as winter is approaching.

It would be great if Manuel can obtain a loan now as he will then be able to get maximum benefit from the planting season.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Virginia is 45 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Virginia has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

Virginia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens, concentrated feed, vitamins, etc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 64 years old and lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married, with five adult-age children. She has a small sari-sari store and has done her farming activity at the same time for twenty years.

She requested a loan to buy two bags of fertilizers and compost to have a good harvest. She has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

In the future, Francisca hopes that her children have a good situation in life.

loans.use: to buy two bags of fertilizers and compost.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to spend on current assets of both of her family's businesses, a wood shop and flour retailing

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
This is Cecilia, who is grateful because a previous loan allowed her to greatly expand her business by buying the gardening materials and supplies that she needed. The loan also helped her pay for everyday items and expenses. She is very positive that she can expand her business further with a loan for 22,000 PHP. She will use this new loan to maintain her garden by buying additional supplies such as wire, baskets, seeds and fertilizer. She will also use this loan to meet family needs. Cecilia's goal is to keep her family healthy and give it a better future. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, wire and baskets.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa a hardworking mother who earns a living by selling produce and is requesting a loan for PHP 3,000 from the Paglaum MPC  to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell. This will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shampoo, hair care products, massage products, straighteners, crèmes, and other supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
Ignacia de 71 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos, cada uno con su propio hogar y uno en el extranjero que le apoya económicamente y con eso cubre los gastos del hogar.
Ignacia es comerciante pequeño, elaborar artesanías religiosas desde hace ya mucho tiempo, las hace en su casa y las personas llegan a comprarle y luego las comercializan en reventa. 
Ignacia solicita el préstamo para comprar hilo, estampas, tela y demás para elaborar su producto, comenta que están próximas las fiestas patronales en su comunidad y espera tener una gran venta; le habría gustado pedir ayuda a su hijo pero tiene dificultades debido a la entrada del invierno en el país donde vive.
Ignacia espera Dios le preste vida para seguir trabajando en lo que le gusta, además disfruta que otras personas gusten de su trabajo
texts.en: Ignacia is 71 years old, single, and has 2 children, each of whom has their own home and one is abroad and helps her economically and with this money she covers her household expenses. Ignacia is a small businesswoman who has been making religious objects for many years. She makes them in her home and people come to buy from her and then resell the items. Ignacia seeks a loan to buy thread, prints, fabric, and other items to make her product. She comments that her community's patron celebrations are approaching and she hopes to have a big sale.  She would have liked to have asked her son for help but he has difficulties with winter coming in the country where he lives. Ignacia hopes that God lends her life to continue working doing what she enjoys, in addition she enjoys that other people like her work.

loans.use: to buy thread, prints, fabric, and other items to make her product

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Teresa es una madre muy amorosa con sus hijos, ella esta casada y tiene 3 hijos mismos de los que 2 están estudiando, Teresa juntamente con su esposo se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, el crédito lo necesita para realizar a compra de una vaca lechera para que por medio de estos ingresos educar y alimentar a sus hijos.
texts.en: Teresa is a mother who loves her children very much. She is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. Together with her husband, Teresa earns her living raising cows and farming. She needs a loan to buy a milk cow. Then with the income she earns from it, she will educate and feed her children.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Francis' Group

texts.en:
Francis is 53 years old and the proud father of 7 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing his group of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Francis has noticed that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Francis described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Francis’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Enos's Group

texts.en:
Enos, pictured above, has six children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Enos is representing his group of 14 farmers in Kakamega South District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Enos has been a farmer for 10 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light. With the profits from this coming season, Enos is planning to save more money for the future.

A total of 5.25 acres will be planted by Enos's Group, and between them, they will receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Oeurn's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Kampong Speu province, Oeurn is 57 years old and a mother of three children; one of whom is in school and one is too young. To support her family, she grows rice as the main source of income to improve her family's condition. She can earn income about 16,000 KHR per day. 

She leads a group of eight to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy a water filter. 

Oeurn hopes that her family has clean water to use.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Cielo Azul Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Cielo Azul está integrado por tres microempresarios exitosos en su vida laboral, quien lo coordina es Yokasta una joven de 20 años de edad, soltera, ella comercializa calzado en el mercado más populoso de la capital desde hace tres años, este negocio lo impulsó hace tres años cuando logró que los proveedores les dieran los productos al créditos, es el quinto ciclo que solicita en ADIM el financiamiento para su negocio, y lo requiere para la compra de zapatos cerrados de damas y caballeros, y sandalias bajas. Con los créditos anteriores ha logrado cubrir parte de la demanda que tiene de estos productos. En este grupo también encontramos a Humberto un hombre de 33 años de edad y quien comercializa ropa de segunda en Chinandega, y Carla de 31 años de edad, quien elabora y vende miel mesada desde hace quince años.
texts.en: The solidarity group "Cielo Azul" is comprised of three microentrepreneurs successful in their working lives. Their coordinator is Yokasta, a single 20-year-old who has sold footwear in the most populous market of the capital for three years. This business was launched three years ago when she was successful in getting providers to make her loans. This is the fifth cycle of requesting financing for her business through ADIM, and she requires it to buy closed shoes for men and women, as well as low sandals. With the previous loans she has been successful meeting the demand for these products. In this group you can also meet Humberto, a 33-year-old man who sells used clothing in Chinandega, and Carla, a 31-year-old who has produced and sold “miel me sabe” (a Nicaraguan dessert made of milk and unrefined cane sugar) for 15 years.

loans.use: to purchase men's and women's footwear which enables her to improve her income

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of two grown-up children from Leyte, Philippines.

Maria runs a small sari-sari (variety) store selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This is the source of her income.

Maria would like to take a loan to buy more stocks of canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, biscuits and snack foods, and other items to sell. A loan will help her improve her stocks, thus attracting more buyers in her store. 

In the future, Maria hopes to make her business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, biscuits and snack foods, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 56 years old and lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and the mother of two adult-aged children. She earns a living by selling rice that she grows on her farm, and is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more fertilizer. She has been a member of PMPC for three years, and is requesting this loan to meet customer demand. In the future, Erlinda hopes that God will bless her business and her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Davies

texts.en:
Davies has a food stall in Nairobi town and also sells poultry. He has been running this business for two years, and right now, he makes a monthly income of KES 30,000. He is 41 years old, married, and together with his spouse, has been blessed with four children. 

He will use this loan to buy more stock of milk, bread, soft drinks, eggs and cakes to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business and educate his children.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and in the future, he hopes to have a prosperous business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, milk, bread, eggs and cakes to sell.

loans.name: Jara Mae

texts.en:
Jara Mae is 20 years old and is the 2nd of 2 children in her family. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,500 to pay her tuition fees for the 2nd semester of the school year 2014-15.

Jara Mae is currently in the 4th year of her 3 years and 6 months Bachelor of Science in Tourism course.

When she graduates, Jara Mae plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Geovani Alexander

texts.es: Solicita el préstamo para poner el ladrillo de piso a su casa, es lo único que falta para pasarse a vivir, ya que donde está alquilando actualmente se ha convertido en una zona conflictiva y peligrosa. El sueño de Geovani es algún día tener su propio taller.
texts.en:
Geovani is requesting a loan in order to install a brick floor in his house. That is the only thing that is lacking before he can move in. He is currently living in a rental since he had to move from a troubled and dangerous area.

His dream is to have a workshop of his own someday.

loans.use: to install a brick floor in his house.

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
"Janet, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 14 farmers in Kakamega South District. She is 62 years old, is married and has 6 children.

Janet likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. Janet plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a cow.

In total, Janet’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 9.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Ernest's Group

texts.en:
Ernest's Group has been formed by 11 farmers in the Kakamega North District and is being represented by Ernest, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 30 years old, is married and has four children. Ernest has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very hard-working individual.

Ernest isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2013 and since then, he's noticed that his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year, Ernest will not only buy fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but he will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition as now he will be able to have light during the dark hours so his children will be able to study.

Using this loan, Ernest's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as maize seeds and fertilizer to improve his maize harvest

loans.name: Christopher's Group

texts.en:
Christopher, pictured above, has five children. He is always described as a very hard-working individual which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Christopher is representing his group of 14 farmers in Kakamega South District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Christopher has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs, such as hybrid seeds and fertilizer, but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be receiving. With the profits from this coming season, Christopher is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 6.5 acres will be planted by Christopher's Group, and between them they will receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en: Abdullahi is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Abdullahi joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Habibu, Barahama and Daiyabu.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdullahi would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdullahi can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Abdullahi  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby reducing pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Deborah's Group

texts.en:
Deborah is 38 years old and has 6 children. She works very hard, and has been a farmer for 19 years. Even though Deborah is the only one featured in the above photo, she is representing her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Deborah started working with One Acre Fund in 2011. She decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training in order to learn new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve because she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills.

Deborah’s Group will receive farming help to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light. With this loan, the group will purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Marta Carolina

texts.es: Marta es una mujer de 25 años de edad se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de platillos típicos, actividad que le ha permitido sostener a su familia desde hace 6 años. Ella tiene 5 años de habitar en la vivienda y es frente a ella que vende sus productos. Marta desea mejorar su negocio ya que para la preparación de sus productos solo cuenta con una cocina que se encuentra deteriorada, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: una cocina nueva y un depósito grande para preparar sus platillos típicos que tanto gustan a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marta, 25, earns a living with a business selling traditional dishes, which has allowed her to support her family for six years.  She has been living in her home for five years, and it's in front of her house that she sells her food.

Marta wants to improve her business because she only has a run-down stove for preparing her dishes.  She's asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in a new stove and a large fuel tank to make the dishes that her customers enjoy so much.

loans.use: to buy a new stove and a large fuel tank to make her traditional dishes

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is thankful that she was previously granted a 15,000 PHP loan. She used it to purchase merchandise and products, to increase her inventory. Through her earnings, she has been able to send her children to school and meet their daily living needs.

Now, she would like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan. She will use the new loan as part of her working capital buy personal products such as footwear, cosmetics and clothing. Part of the loan she will also use to maintain the personal computers of her Piso-Net business, where she appears, in her photo. She will use her earnings to meet her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Raquel dreams of having her own store to display her products and a bigger computer shop, in the future. She aims to give her children the best education. She desires that they will lead a happy and quiet life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies .


*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics, needed in her business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
This is Eva. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had entrenched her business. She was able to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could further improve her business if you will let her borrow again an amount of 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of accessories and spare parts for their jeepney. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family if the unit is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Eva is hoping to buy another jeepney unit and she desires for her children to be able to complete their studies. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the jeepney, as well as to perform necessary maintenance

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is a young business man from an outskirt of Mbarara town. He is 28 years of age and is married to a young supportive lady. They have 2 children together.

He is from a poor family which failed to give him an adequate education, so he stopped in Senior 2 level. He failed to get any job and struggled as a roadside vendor. He would walk almost all the streets of Mbarara selling roasted grains to earn a living. Yet, indeed, he accumulated some small capital and opened a small retail shop in a nearby trading centre which kept growing and growing.

Currently there is high competition in the business and he always finds himself out competed by the neighboring shop keepers. As a result, he came last year for a loan of 1,000,000 which he serviced very well and that boosted his income and grew his business. He has come again, this time requesting another loan of ugx.2,000,000 to buy more of the sought-after items so that he can expand the business and increase his profit.

loans.use: to buy soda, pampers, sugar, corn, wheat flour and other items to sell.

loans.name: Titus' Group

texts.en:
Titus, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing his group, formed by 14 farmers in Teso District, Kenya. He joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011, and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He is married and has 2 children.

With a portion of this loan, Titus will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Purchasing a solar light with part of his loan means that now he will be able to have an overall improved quality of life. Titus plans to use the profits he gains this year to invest in a business.

In total Titus’ group will use the money received from this loan to plant a total of 8 acres of land. They will also purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose's Group consists of 11 farmers in the Teso District of Kenya and is represented by Rose, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 48 years old, married, and has 2 children. Rose has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Rose isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life change; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. 

This year, Rose will not only receive fertilizer and maize seeds with her part of the loan, but she will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition, since now she will be able to have light for her children to study during dark hours.

Using their loan portions, the rest of Rose's Group will be able to purchase a total of 7 solar lights, as well use the fertilizer and seed inputs received to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Las Flores De Tambocorral Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS FLORES DE TAMBOCORRAL”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Teresa, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Angelica Teofila ella es soltera y tiene 52 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva platanos, cafe, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "LAS FLORES DE TAMBOCORRAL" which is located in the district of Santa Teresa which in the province of La Convención in the department of Cusco.

One of the members, Angelica Teofila, is 52 years old, single and the mother of two children.  She works cultivating fruit and has land where she grows bananas, coffee, tangerines and oranges.  She works from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and has been in business successfully for several years.  Her dream is to expand her cropland.  The loan she is requesting is to buy seeds and fertilizers.

The other members are involved in businesses such as animal sales, clothing sales, a grocery store and food sales.

The member is grateful to the people taking part in her dream through this loan and she is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad productora de caña donde la máxima fuente de empleo es el ingenio (fábrica dazucarera) un grupo de 6 mujeres ha solicitado un préstamo a VisionFund con el firme propósito de invertirlo cada una en su actividad económica. El grupo lleva por nombre Las Estrellas. Las integrantes son:

Concepsión -Venta De Cosméticos Por Catalogo
Erika -Venta De Zapatos
Sotera -Venta De Abarrotes
Rosa - Venta De Abarrotes
Ana -Venta De Ropa
Flor -Venta De Abarrotes

Doña Sotera tiene 56 años de edad y está casada con el señor Silvestre con quien procreó 4 hijos, todos ya son mayores de edad. Desde hace 10 años Doña Sotera se levanta desde muy temprano para abrir la cortina que cubre su tienda de abarrotes. Con gran esfuerzo inició su negocio, su propósito era sentirse útil, obtener más ingresos y mantenerse ocupada. Recuerda que al principio fue un poco difícil ver el producto de su trabajo ya que la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitaban mercancía fiada por la falta de dinero (llevarse los productos y pagar en cuotas); en muchas ocasiones, nunca recibió el pago completo. Ante esta situación y experiencia, una de las frases favoritas de Doña Sotera es "No dos veces se muere el burro en el mismo persogadero" (Fool me once, same on you. fool me twice, shame on me).

Actualmente, la mercancía que más se vende es: frijol, arroz, azúcar, sopa, chiles, huevos, aceite, papel higiénico, leche y queso por lo que requiere invertir constantemente en estos mismos productos. Día a día, sotera hace todo loposible para ofrecer un servicio de calidad y buen trato a los clientes; siempre está al tanto de la fecha de caducidad de sus productos y trata de mantener una sonrisa en el rostro. Con las ganancias que ha obtenido, a lo largo del tiempo ha incrementado la variedad de productos y la cantidad de mercancía. También ha comenzado a vender algunos artículos de papelería. 

Para llevar el negocio nuevamente hacia adelante, Sotera quiere cambiar los anaqueles de la tienda por lo que ha comenzado a ahorrar y cuenta con mantener el apoyo de VisionFund en futuras ocasiones. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de abarrotes de la señora Sotera quien viste una blusa de color azul. Además de las integrantes, también se pueden apreciar distintos productos que Sotera comercializa en su tienda.
texts.en:
In a sugar cane producing community where the greatest source of employment is the sugar factory, a group of six women has applied to VisionFund for a loan, with the resolute intention of each one investing it in her business. The group is named Las Estrellas (The Stars). The members are: Concepsión, who sells cosmetics by catalog; Erika, who sells shoes; Sotera, who sells groceries; Rosa, who sells groceries; Ana, who sells clothes; and Flor, who sells groceries.

Doña Sotera is 56 years old and is married to Señor Silvestre, with whom she has four children. All are already adults. For 10 years, Doña Sotera has gotten up very early to open the shutter that covers her grocery store. With great effort, she began her business. Her intention was to feel useful, obtain more income, and keep herself busy. She remembers that at the beginning it was a little difficult to see the results of her work, since the majority of her customers asked for merchandise on credit due to the lack of money (to take the product and pay in installments). On many occasions she never received the complete payment. In the face of this situation and experience, one of Doña Sotera's favorite phrases is "Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me."

At this time, the merchandise that is sold the most are beans, rice, sugar, soup, peppers, eggs, oil, toilet paper, milk and cheese, for which reason she needs to invest constantly in these same products. Day after day, Sotera does everything possible to offer quality service and good treatment to the customers. She always keeps track of the expiration date of her products and tries to keep a smile on her face. With the earnings that she has obtained, over time she has increased the variety of products and the quantity of merchandise. She has also begun to sell some stationery articles.

To again take the business forward, Sotera wants to change the shelves of the store, for which she has begun to save and is counting on keeping the support of VisionFund on future occasions.

The photograph was taken on the grocery store of Doña Sotera, who is wearing a blue blouse. Furthermore you can see the other group members and the products for sale in the shop.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, soup, peppers, eggs, oil, toilet paper, milk, cheese, purified water, soft drinks, and juices for her store.

loans.name: Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del grupo “Vista Hermosa” se conocen muy bien, su amistad se ha fortalecido con el paso de los años, viven en la misma comunidad por lo que siempre se organizan para disfrutar un buen momento durante las fiestas tradicionales. Ellos practican la religión cristiana y el día 10 de marzo celebran el aniversario del templo, su culto más importante. 

Lucila, es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta de 30 años de edad, su marido trabaja en la construcción de casas y son padres de 3 niños que se encuentran estudiando su educación primaria. Anteriormente, la familia vivía en la capital del país, pero vivir en la ciudad significaba muchos gastos y el sueldo de su esposo era el mínimo lo cual no era suficiente para solventar todos los gastos de hogar. Fue entonces que decidió iniciar a vender antojitos mexicanos como chicharrones preparados, patitas de pollo, elotes, esquites, entre otros.

El negocio resultó productivo porque a los clientes les gustaba el sazón de Lucila y así permaneció durante dos años. Todas las tardes, afuera de la casa donde rentaba colocaba una mesita para vender, pero desafortunadamente otras señoras comenzaron  negocios muy similares y el de Lucila fue decayendo poco a poco y lo tuvo que abandonar. Un día, su esposo también tuvo un mal momento y se quedó sin empleo, fue cuando se vieron obligados a regresar a su comunidad donde llevan viviendo ya 8 años.

Hace 5 años, Lucila le dió otra oportunidad al comercio vendiendo dulces frente a una escuela primaria, pero le gustaría retomar la venta de sus antojitos mexicanos porque sabe que las ganancias son mayores. Con la venta de una paleta ella gana sólo un peso, pero con un platillo, gana alrededor de 10. Por el momento Lucila no cuenta con la inversión para iniciar el negocio de comida, pero trabajará para lograrlo, así que necesita un préstamo que invertirá en dulces, con su ingreso apoyará a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y seguirá ahorrando. Sin embargo, el mayor sueño de Lucila es mejorar su vivienda, hasta ahora el piso es de tierra y las ventanas las adecuaron para cubrirse del frío, pero ella quiere un mejor hogar para su familia.

Así como Lucila quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos, los demás integrantes también trabajan por sus seres queridos: Don Roberto quiere invertir en su taxi; Gabriel, Mauricio y Ángel, en la cría de animales y Cristina, en una refaccionaria. 

*La fotografía se tomó junto al taxi de Roberto, su vehículo transita en la capital del país y no en la comunidad donde vive. Lucila viste una playera de color Rosa.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Vista Hermosa" [Beautiful View] know each other very well. Their friendship has been strengthened through the years. They live in the same community, and so they always get together to enjoy traditional celebrations. They are Christians, and on March 10th they celebrate the anniversary of the church, their most important moment of worship.

Lucila is a very hardworking and enthusiastic 30-year-old woman. Her husband builds houses, and they have 3 children who study in primary school. The family used to live in the country's capital, but living in the city meant many expenses. Her husband earned the minimum salary which wasn't sufficient to cover all of the household expenses. It was then that she decided to start selling Mexican snacks such as prepared pork rinds, chicken drumsticks, corn on the cob, and popcorn among other things.

The business was productive because Lucila's customers liked the flavor of her food, and it remained this way for two years. Every afternoon, outside of the house she rented, she set up a table to sell from. Unfortunately, other women started similar businesses, and so Lucila's business declined little by little, and she had to shut it down. One day, her husband also had a bad moment and was left without work. That was when they realized they had to return to their community where they have been living now for 8 years.

Five years ago, Lucila gave her business another shot selling sweets in front of a primary school. However, she would like to resume selling her Mexican snacks because she knows that she earns more profit. She only earns 1 peso with the sale of a sucker, but she earns around 10 pesos with the sale of a plate of snacks. For the moment, Lucila doesn't have the resources to start her food business, but she will work to achieve it. She needs a loan that she will use to invest in sweets. Her income will help her husband with the household expenses and she will continue to save. However, her biggest dream is to improve her home. The floor in her house is dirt, and they have adapted their windows to protect from the cold, but she wants a better home for her family.

Just as Lucila wants to improve her quality of life and that of her children, the other members also work for their loved ones. Don Roberto wants to invest in his taxi; Gabriel, Mauricio, and Ángel want to breed animals; and Cristina wants to invest in a repair shop.

* The photograph was taken next to Roberto's taxi. His taxi circulates in the country's capital, and not in the community where he lives. Lucila is wearing a pink t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy a variety of sweets.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo “La Nueva Esperanza” está integrado por personas muy trabajadoras, cada uno de ellos tiene un espíritu emprendedor. Claro ejemplo de ello es Doña Cristina quien tiene 41 años de edad está casada con el señor Gabino y tienen tres hijas, dos de ellas apun dependen de la pareja.

Doña Cristina o Cris, como le llaman de cariño, tiene muy  buena amistad con sus vecinas es muy sonriente y amable. Hace 23 años, nació su primera niña y fue cuando inició su negocio. Su esposo siempre da había dedicado a al venta de tacos así que con gran esfuerzo esfuerzo ambos reunieron el dinero suficiente y al cabo de un año compraron un pequeño carrito para vender tacos de forma ambulante. Actualmente ya cuentan con dos carros para que ambos puedan trabajar y abarcar más puntos de venta. Todos los días Cris coloca el carrito en el mercado desde las 8 am hasta las 11 pm. La pareja debe enfrentar la gran competencia que hay en la comunidad y la cual ha ido incrementando con el tiempo. A pesar de ello Cris sigue con la idea firme de alcanzar sus sueño que es seguir apoyando a sus hijas para que puedan terminar su carrera profesional.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son Ana Maria y Teodora quienes invertirán en la venta de tacos; J.Carmen, en talachas; Juan Luis, en su cibercafé; José Juan y Francisco, en la venta de tortillas e Imelda y María, en la venta de zapatos por catálogos.

*La fotografía se tomó al lado de los carritos de tacos de Doña Ana María, Cristina viste un suéter color rosa.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Esperanza" group is made up of very hard-working members, each one of whom is very enterprising. A good example of this is 41-year-old Cristina. She is married to Gabino; the couple has three daughters, two of whom still depend on their parents.

Cristina, lovingly known as Cris, is very good friends with her neighbours. She is very happy and friendly. Twenty-three years ago Cris had her first daughter and also started her business selling tacos. Cris' husband has always made a living selling tacos and, together, with a lot of hard work, the couple were able to save up enough money after one year to buy a cart for selling tacos. The couple now has two carts, allowing them both to work and make more sales. Every day Cris sets up her cart at the market from 8am until 11pm. 

The couple has a lot of competition, which has increased with time. In spite of this, Cris still wants to achieve her dream of supporting her daughters so that they may have a profession.

The other members of this group are: Ana María and Teodora, who will also invest in selling tacos; Carmen, who will sell mattocks; Juan Luis, who has an internet café; José Juan and Francisco, who both sell tortillas; and María, who has a business selling shoes from catalogues.

*The photograph was taken beside Ana María's carts. In it, Cristina is wearing a pink sweater,

loans.use: para comprar nuevas llantas para el carrito

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Un agricultor no sólo es una persona que a través de la siembra y la cosecha produce alimentos para vivir. También es un ejemplo de paciencia, perseverancia y sobre todo con una actitud mental positiva, requisito indispensable para alcanzar el éxito así es el trabajo que ejerce Francisco, el cual se siente agradecido con la ayuda de parte de MiCrédito con el primer crédito que le ayudo a pagarle a sus trabajadores, también compro insumos agrícolas que le ayudaron a cultivar y a obtener una gran cosecha, Francisco pudo sembrar repollo, lo cual le fue de gran ayuda los fertilizantes, agroquímicos y nutrientes para aplicarlos en su tierra, todos estos productos obtenidos con el crédito anterior. 
El agricultor desarrolla una actividad basada en el conocimiento, la paciencia y la esperanza, de que la tierra dará sus frutos. Pero la tierra por sí sola no dará la cosecha, se requiere de un trabajo arduo, realizado con ternura y dedicación. Francisco sigue trabajando arduamente para seguir creciendo como productor, este le permitirá abrir otros campos de producción, donde podrá cosechar una variedad de los alimentos usuales que consume la población. Solicita el crédito para la compra de insecticidas, fumigicidas, urea, para mantener su siembra de tomates semitecnificados, deposita su confianza en el financiamiento que le ayudara a mejorar su calidad de vida, como agricultor, productor y padre de familia.
texts.en:
A farmer is not only someone who plants and harvests food for a living.  He is an example of patience, perseverance and, above all else, a positive attitude which is a requirement to be successful in the line of work Francisco is in.  He is grateful for the help from MiCrédito through the first loan which helped him pay workers.  He also bought farm supplies that helped him obtain a good harvest.  Francisco was able to grow cabbage with the help of the fertilizers, agrochemicals and nutrients he used on his soil.  He obtained all these products with the previous loan.

A farmer carries out his activity based on his knowledge, patience and the hope that the earth with bear fruit.  But the earth does not do this alone.  It requires hard work, along with tenderness and dedication.  Francisco continues working hard to grow as a producer.  This will allow him to open other production fields where he can produce a variety of foods consumed by the locals.  He is requesting a loan to buy insecticides, pesticides and urea to care for his semi-technified tomatoes.  He trusts the loan will help improve his quality of life as a farmer, producer and father.

loans.use: To buy insecticides,pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Jesús Arturo

texts.es:
Jesús es agricultor de granos básicos, empezó a trabajar desde los 8 años de edad debido a que su padre murió y había que cubrir los gastos del hogar. Él alquila terreno para sembrar y camina 20 minutos para llegar y trabaja de lunes a sábado.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa de damas y caballeros para vender junto a su esposa, ella tiene mucha experiencia y comenta que las personas compran ropa para regalar o usar, además va a comprar tres cerdos pequeños para engordarlos. Jesús espera con el tiempo comprar un terreno para construir su propia casa ya que por el momento está viviendo en la casa de un padrino.
texts.en:
Jesús is a basic grains farmer. He started to work when he was 8 years old because his mother died and he had to cover the household expenses. He rents farmland and walks 20 minutes to get there.  He works from Monday through Saturday.

Jesus is asking for this loan so he can buy men's and women's clothing to sell with his wife. She has a lot of experience and states that people buy clothing to give as gifts and for themselves. He is also going to buy 3 small pigs to fatten. 

Over time, Jesus hopes to buy some land to build his own house. He is currently living in the house of one of his godfathers.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing to sell with his wife.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Juan, de 38 años de edad, estudió hasta octavo año de secundaria, está casado, su esposa se dedicá a los oficios domésticos, tiene 3 hijos, el hijo mayor actualmente está aprendiendo mecánica,y los otros están estudiando.

Juan, se dedica a la venta de helados, actividad que realiza en las tardes, él sale a vender en su motocicleta a los diferentes caseríos cercanos a su comunidad. Trabajó para muchas empresas de bebidas por mucho tiempo.-

Posteriormente, trabajó en una empresa de helados, como vendedor, luego como supervisor, y fue ahí como el conoció el negocio y tomó la decisión de tener su propio negocio de venta de helados.

Con el préstamo anterior, Juan compró una motocicleta para movilizarse mas rápido y vender su producto, ésta vez Juan, utilizará el préstamo para comprar conos de galleta, frutas, azucar, leche, entre otros insumos para su negocio.- 

Además, comprará un carrito que le venden en oferta, con el cual podrá realizar viajes y generar mas ingresos por ese servicio.
texts.en:
Juan is 38 years old, and he studied until eighth grade in school. He is married, and his wife is a homemaker. He has 3 children. The oldest is currently learning mechanics, and the others are studying.

Juan makes a living selling ice cream, an occupation which he does in the afternoons. He travels to small villages near his town by motorcycle to sell. He worked for many drink companies for a long time.

Previously, he worked in an ice cream company, as a seller, and later as a supervisor. It was there that he learned the business, and made the decision to start his own business selling ice cream.

With the previous loan, Juan bought a motorcycle to get around more quickly to sell his products. This time, Juan will use the loan to buy ice cream cones, fruit, sugar, and milk, among other consumables for his business.

In addition, he will buy a shopping cart that is on sale, which he will use to make trips and generate more income with this service.

loans.use: to buy ice cream cones, fruit, sugar, and milk, among other consumables for his business.

loans.name: Marsiliana's Group

texts.en:
"Marsiliana, pictured above, has 6 children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Marsiliana is representing her group of 15 farmers in Teso District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Marsiliana has been a farmer for more than 40 years and, in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Marsiliana is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 6.25 acres will be planted by Marsiliana's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 15 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Cosmas's Group

texts.en:
Cosmas is a 70-year-old proud father of 5 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in the Webuye district. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Cosmas has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Cosmas described his harvest as excellent last year, but he believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Cosmas’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Amos's Group

texts.en:
"Amos, featured in the above picture, is representing his farming group formed by 5 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. He is 53 years old and a married father of 9 children, often described as a very reliable person. 

Although Amos has been a farmer for 20 years, he is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because he really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though he is new to the program, Amos wanted to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Amos hopes to be able to send his children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 3.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 2 solar lights, as, even though Amos decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Enes's Group

texts.en:
Enes is 60 years old and has nine children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye district, Kenya. 

Enes has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as poor, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Enes also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that, between the 11 farmers in Enes's Group, the group will purchase a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Joan's Group

texts.en:
Joan, pictured above, has 5 children and is always described as a very trustworthy person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Joan is representing her group of 6 farmers in Butere District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Joan has been a farmer for 15 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light. With the profits from this coming season, Joan is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 2.5 acres will be planted by Joan's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Benard's Group

texts.en:
"Pictured above is Benard, often described as an extremely trustworthy person. He is 38 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 16 farmers in Teso Distric, Kenya.  He is married and has 4 children.

Benard is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Benard says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2012, he has learnt a lot from farming trainings, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Benard will use the profits from this season to send his children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase a total of 10 solar lights as well as seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 9.5 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 10 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Los Tres Lirios Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Los Tres Lirios lo integran tres microempresarios laboriosos para que a su familia no le haga falta el pan de cada día, quien lo coordina es Álvaro un hombre de  32 años de edad, acompañado y quien brinda el servicio de transporte (Caponera) en su comunidad, este negocio lo impulso hace nueve años primeramente inicio como cadete luego de los ingresos que recibía compró su propia caponera, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de llantas y forros, ya que con los créditos anteriores ha logrado mejorar su medio de trabajo por lo que sus ingresos han mejorado. Otro de los socios es Edgar un hombre de la edad de 47 años su negocio es la comercialización de pan desde hace dos años en los al rededores de su comunidad, y Alfonso de 63 años de edad y quien vende CD en Jinotepe desde hace treinta años.
texts.en:
Three hardworking micro-entrepreneurs belong to Los Tres Lirios Communal Bank so their families never lack anything to eat.

Álvaro, 32, is the coordinator.  He's in a relationship and works providing motorcycle taxi transportation services in his community.  He began as a driver, then bought his own motorcycle taxi with the income he earned.

He's requesting the loan to buy tires and seat covers.  With the previous loans he was able to improve the way he works, which improved his income.

The other members are Edgar, 47, who has sold bread throughout his community for two years, and Alfonso, 63, who has sold CDs around Jinotepe for 30 years.

loans.use: to buy tires and seat covers to provide better service

loans.name: Sakhi Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
42-year-old Parvatiben (at center in the picture), from Surendranagar in Gujarat, runs her own small-scale dairy business. She rears a cow, and sells its milk, earning INR 5,000 a month. She saves the entire amount with the goal of providing for her children’s education. She has four children: a pre-schooler, two primary-school going children, and a teenager in secondary school. 

In addition to running her small business, she is a diligent homemaker, exceptionally adept at balancing her family’s finances. Using only her husband’s income of INR 8,000 a month, she covers the living expenses for her family of seven and school costs for her four children. In stretching her finances thinly, though, she does end up compromising on some of her family’s needs. She hopes to change this by achieving financial stability and improving their living conditions. Also, she is aware that her current savings cannot put four children through public college, which, she believes, will change their prospects for the better. 

So, to earn more and achieve her goals, she has decided to grow her milk selling business into a full-fledged dairy microenterprise. In running her household on a tight budget, Parvatiben has, over the years, excelled at culinary skills like making yogurt, buttermilk, butter, and ghee (a rich clarified butter) from scratch for her family’s needs. She now wants to make these products and sell them to her customers. In Gujarat, where Parvatiben lives, these dairy products are always in demand, so there will be no dearth of business. To put her plan into action, she needs more milk, and the cheapest way to source this is to buy another cow. 

She formed the Sakhi Mahila Mandal, a joint liability group, to access the microfinance necessary to buy this cow. Her fellow borrowers are Amaraben and Ranjanben who want to grow their own rickshaw services, and Laxmiben and Bhavnaben who will scale up their clothes selling microenterprises. Together, they seek a loan of INR 80,000. Your timely loan will help Parvatiben capitalize on the spike in demand for dairy products during this auspicious festive and wedding season. Her enterprise will earn, on an average, an extra INR 7,000 per month. She is grateful for this opportunity and your support to achieve her hopes and goals for her family.

loans.use: To buy a cow for her dairy microenterprise so she can make and sell dairy products

loans.name: Tajibal Group

texts.es:
Lourdes es una mujer de 27 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 9, 7 y 4 años, y su negocio es la venta de pollo a la broaster.
Ella es buena madre, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y  comprometida con su trabajo. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un sitio caracterizado por el gigantesco crecimiento de su población; migrantes de occidente del país y etnias como ‘Los Ayoreos’ nativas del lugar, se establecieron, actualmente su 2 generación se ocupa del comercio y la manufactura en todas las áreas. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados y durante todo el año.
Lourdes es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (la primera de la derecha, polera celeste y pantalon azul). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al transporte libre como taxi, y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela y el menor se encuentra al cuidado de su madre. Viven en una casa construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Las ancías por ampliar su negocio para generear mejores ingresos por el bienestar de su familia la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de cubiertas de celulares, venta de hoja de coca, venta de jugo de quinua, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos, venta de polleras, venta de helado y elaboración de empanadas, para solicitar un préstamo y continuar con sus actividades. Su negocio es la preparación y venta de pollo a la broaster (pollo frito), que realiza en un cuarto bajo techo en una avenida conocida. Su negocio cuenta con clientes diarios y constantes, sus ventas son buenas porque el pollo es muy consumido en el lugar y la manera en que lo prepara hace que su negocio sea prospero. “cocinar bien el pollo asegura la destrucción de microorganismos, pero hay que tener cuidado si el pollo es sometido a una excesiva cocción se corre el riesgo de que la carne se seque y pierda las vitaminas…” comenta. Su sueño es tener otro puesto de venta de pollo frito. Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la apertura de otro puesto de venta de pollo a la broaster. Esta es su 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lourdes solicita un préstamo para la apertura de un puesto de venta de pollo a la broaster y sastisfacer a nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a 27 year old woman, lives with her partner, has 3 children ages 9, 7 and 4.  Her business is to sell fried chicken.
She is a good mom, joyful, optimist, happy, with a good attitude, responsible and committed to her work.  Her business is located in zone "plan 3000" a place characterized for the huge growth of its population; migrants from the west of the country and groups like "Los Ayoreos" native from the area are established there.  Currently the 2nd generation is in charge of commerce and manufacture in all areas.  The weather is warm, tropical and humid with a temperature that averages during the day between 21-35 degrees Celsius year round.
Lourdes has dark skin, long black hair, short and her mother tongue is Guarani and Spanish from day to day culture and her business (she is the first one from the right, blue top and blue pants).  Her life is shared with her partner who works in transportation as a taxi driver. She has two children, two are in school and the little one is taken care of by her mom. They live in a house build with brick that has running water, electricity and sewage. Her eagerness to expand the business and generate more income for her family's well being led her to form part of a group of people with businesses, such as: perfume sales, soda sales, clothing sales, ice cream sales, empanada making, the group requests loans to continue with their activities. Her business is the making and sale of fried chicken, which she makes in a room in a known avenue.  Her business has daily and constant customers, her sales are good because chicken is of high consumption in the area and the way she prepares it makes her business successful. "Cooking the chicken well ensures the destruction of microorganisms, but one has to be careful to not overcook the chicken as the meat can dry out and lose it's vitamins..." she commented. Her dream is to have another stand of fried chicken and wants to expand her business by opening another location to sell broaster (fried) style chicken.  This is her first cycle with the institution and has 3 years with her business.  These are the reasons that Lourdes requests the loan to open another fried chicken location to satisfy new customers.

loans.use: to open a stand selling fried chicken and satisfy new customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy shoes, bread, and Omnilife products.

loans.name: Nicarao Del Valle Group

texts.es: Nicarao del Valle es un grupo solidario integrado por cinco socios exitosos en sus labores diarios y que solicitan por primera vez en ADIM un financiamiento para sus negocios con el objetivo de incrementar su capital de trabajo, quien lo coordina es Ana una mujer emprendedora de 32 años de edad, acompañada y comerciante de perecederos de manera ambulante en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace diez años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de tomate, cebolla, chiltoma, papas y lechugas. El resto de los integrantes son, Sebastiana una mujer de 39 años de edad, quien comercializa pan y derivados del maíz desde hace diez años en las calles de la ciudad de Granada, Leticia una joven de 21 años de edad comerciante de frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal, Lituania joven que tiene la edad de 23 años de edad y dedicada a la comercialización de ropa nueva en su comunidad desde hace dos años, y Carlos un hombre de 32 años de edad y quien se dedica a la comercialización de ropa y especies en las comunidades desde hace dieciocho años.
texts.en:
Nicarao del Valle is a solidarity group composed of five members who are successful in their daily work and are asking for the first time in ADIM funding for their businesses in order to increase their working capital. 

The group is coordinated by Ana, an enterprising 32-year-old woman. She is in a relationship and is a street vendor who has sold perishable goods in the municipal market for ten years. She is asking for a loan to buy tomatoes, onions, bell peppers, potatoes and lettuces.
