The rest of the members are: Sebastiana, a 39-year-old woman who has sold bread and corn products for ten years on the streets of the city of Granada; Leticia, a 21-year-old woman who sells fruit and vegetables in the municipal market; Lituania, a 23-year-old woman who has sold new clothing in her community for two years; and Carlos, a 32-year-old man who has sold clothing and spices in the local communities for eighteen years.

loans.use: To buy tomato, onions, chilis, potatoes, and lettuce to meet the demand for these goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities, while earning a living for her family. As a microfinance member of PMPC, she has sought financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell. In the future, Marilyn wishes to become the supplier of flowers in neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 50 years old, married to John, and blessed with six children aged between 18 years and six years old. She has been doing crop farming for the last seven years and earns a monthly income of KES.12,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 		
She has applied for her first loan of 20,000 KES from ‘VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire loan amount to buy farm inputs, that is, fertilizers and seedlings for use in the preparation of the next season of planting.                                                                                           

Margaret will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs and also buy more seedlings. She hopes to grow her business and be able to venture into large-scale farming.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, that is, fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Randy

texts.es: Randy  tiene la edad de 21 años, vive en unión libre y su esposa es su mayor tesoro. Con el crédito el quiere ayudarse para trabajar en su cafetal. Tiene que comprar almacigo para sembrar algunas matas que necesitan ser reemplazadas, comprar abono y fungicidas contra las plagas que a atacan su plantación. Su objetivo principal es lograr asistir lo mejor posible su cafetal para que el próximo año su cosecha sea mejor que la producida este año y con esto poder tener el y dar a su esposa una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en: Randy is 21 years old, lives in a domestic partnership, and his wife is his greatest treasure. He wants to use this loan to work on his coffee plantation. He needs to buy seedlings for areas that need  replanting as well as fertilizer and fungicides to protect his plants from pests. His principle objective is to strive to help his coffee plants to the greatest degree, so that next year his harvest will be better than what he produced this year, and with that he will be able to have and to give to his wife better living conditions.

loans.use: to maintain coffee plants.

loans.name: Jenes

texts.en:
Jenes has a retail and grocery shop in Tala town and has been running this business for two years. She is 29 years old, married, and together with her spouse, she has been blessed with two children.

She will use this loan to expand her business by buying more stock of goods such as flour, cooking fat, rice, sugar and cereals for sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.



This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she paid all her previous loans successfully. In future she hopes to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods such as sugar, wheat flour, rice, milk, and bread.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with five children, all of whom go to school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Susan has a business selling Airtime and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more Airtime. 

Susan also generates additional income from selling soft drinks. She sells on both a retail and wholesale basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. 

Susan aspires to own a fully stocked phone accessories shop and also to build a residential house. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care.

loans.use: To buy Airtime packs, crates of soda, and other soft drinks

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en: Aminah is a single mother of four children and three go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for electricity bills. Aminah makes cassava chips, cabbage and potato chips at the market and has been in this business for seven years. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. Aisha has applied for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy cooking oil,irish potatoes,cabbages and spices. She would like to buy better serving dishes and also a fridge to start selling cold drinks.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, Irish potatoes, cabbages and spices.

loans.name: Claudia Paola

texts.es: Claudia es una emprendedora mujer de 30 años de edad,  ella trabajó muchos años en una droguería de la cual se retiró para iniciar su propio negocio, gracias a la ayuda de su esposo y unos ahorros en enero del año 2014, aperturó su propia droguería en la cual comercializa todo tipo de productos de la industria farmacéutica para el cuidado de la salud.  Su horario de atención es de lunes a domingo de 8:00 a.m. a 8 p.m., y sus principales clientes son los vecinos que residen en el sector y transeúntes del lugar,  ubicado en el municipio de soledad, quienes realizan sus compras de contado.  Pese a su escaso capital, Claudia realiza sus compras a sus proveedores y cancela de contado, sin embargo le es insuficiente el surtido en su droguería; por las razones anteriormente descritas, ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual invertirá en medicamentos para incrementar su stock y surtido de producto.  Esta inversión afectará positivamente sus ventas y con ello las utilidades, puesto que los clientes podrán encontrar en un solo lugar todo lo que necesitan. Claudia es madre de dos hijas  de 7 y 9 años de edad, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, y que ella considera podrá alcanzar por intermedio de fuentes de financiación que aporten a mejorar la imagen de su negocio en todos los aspectos.
texts.en: Claudia is a 30 year old entrepreneur.  She worked at a pharmacy for many years and left to start her own business.  Thanks to her husband's help and some savings in January 2014 she opened her own pharmacy where she sells all types of health care products from the pharmaceutical industry. Her schedule is from Monday to Sunday from 8 am to 8 pm, her main customers are neighbors that live in the area or traffic that goes by. It is located in the municipality of soledad, customers make their purchases in cash.  In spite of the low capital, Claudia buys from vendors and pays to them in cash, however her stock is insufficient at the pharmacy, and this is why she is applying for a credikiva. This is the first loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Doming and she will invest in buying medicine to increase her stock and variety of product.  This investment will positively affect her sales and profit because her customers will be able to find everything they need in one location.  Claudia is the mother of two daughters ages 7 and 9.  She wants to give them a better quality of life and considers possible to do it through these financing sources that provide a better image to her business in every way.

loans.use: to buy medicine to increase her stock and variety of products.

loans.name: Rosa De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Rosa de Guadalupe lo integran tres mujeres emprendedoras, quien lo coordina es Yareli una mujer de 26 años de edad, soltera, y quien se dedica a la hecha y venta de tortillas en su domicilio desde hace cinco años, este negocio lo impulso con ayuda financiera de su mamá, es segundo ciclo que ADIM le brinda el financiamiento para su negocio, y solicita el crédito para la compra de maíz, leña, bolsas y el pago de la molida de los ingredientes, con el crédito anterior logró mejorar sus ingresos. El resto de los integrantes son, Yadrela una joven de 21 años de edad, quien vende cabeza de chancho (una de las comidas representativa de la municipalidad) desde hace tres años en su domicilio, y Gabriela una mujer de 30 años de edad, quien comercializa muebles en su domicilio desde hace ocho años.
texts.en: The group Rosa de Guadalupe is formed by three hard-working female members and is coordinated by 26-year-old Yareli. She is single, she makes and sells tortillas at home, this is her 5th year doing it and she started the business with the financial help from her mother.  This is the second cycle with ADIM who provides financing for her business and requests the loan to buy corn, firewood, bags and to pay to have the ingredients milled.  With the previous loan she was able to make more profits.  The remaining members are Yadrela, a 21 year-old young lady that sells pork (one of the typical foods from the municipality) she's had this business for 3 years.  Gabriela is the other member, she is 30 and for 8 years she's been selling furniture from her residence.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, bags and to pay to have the ingredients milled.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.es: Jimmy tiene la edad  de 31 años, está en unión libre, vive con la esposa y tres hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Jimmy is 31, lives with his common law wife and 3 children that are his priority.  With the loan he plans to buy fertilizers, fungicide and pay for labor to help him with coffee.  He also wants to buy some almacigo plants to replant when rain season starts.  This is with the goal to increase the density of plants in the area and take advantage of the good fertility of the soil, weather conditions and other reasons that are good for coffee plantations.  With this improvements he hopes to make some profits and improve the life conditions of his family.  He also wants to invest more in agriculture and achieve some of his goals.  This is the first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He has never had previous loans with state banks but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan with more credit facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy agriculture inputs for coffee plantation.

loans.name: El Manguito Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario El Manguito, lo integran cuatro mujeres laboriosas quienes solicitan el por tercera vez en ADIM el financiamiento para sus negocios. Es coordinado por la señora Lillieth de 28 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos, por quienes se esfuerza aún más se dedica a la hecha y venta de cereales, comercializándolos principalmente en uno de los mercados de la capital, este negocio lo impulsó hace cinco años con ayuda financiera de su esposo, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de quintal de maíz, cacao, leña, pimienta de chapa, pago por la molida de los ingredientes, etc., con los créditos anteriores ha logrado realizar mejora en su vivienda, además logró ampliar el tramo donde comercializa sus productos. El resto de las integrantes son, Maryory de 35 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería desde hace dos años, Erica de 39 años de edad, comerciante de productos comestibles, y Sofía una mujer de 27 años de edad dedicada a la compra-venta de cosechas.
texts.en: The group "El Manguito" consists of four hardworking women who request a loan for the third time with ADIM for their businesses.  The group is coordinated by Lillieth. She is 28 years old, married and mother of two children, for whom she makes an additional effort. She makes and sells cereals in one of the markets of the capital. She started this business 5 years ago with financial help from her husband. She requests the loan to buy 100 lbs of corn, cocoa beans, firewood, cloves and to have the ingredients milled. With the previous loans she was able to make improvements to her house, she was also able to expand the area where she sells her products . The remaining members are: Maryory who is 35 years old and for the past 2 years has run a small grocery store from her home.  Erica is 39 years old and sells various edible products and Sofia who is 27 and buys and sells harvested products.

loans.use: to buy 100 lbs of corn, cocoa beans, firewood, cloves and to have the ingredients milled, to offer good quality products.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es:
Benedicto tiene 3 hijos, él vive junto a su esposa en una de las comunidades de Solola, él tiene 30 años de edad.

Benedicto es un hombre que le gusta convivir con la naturaleza, y le encanta la agricultura, en el lugar donde vive Benedicto mucha gente se dedica a este trabajo, Benedicto normalmente siembra papa, zanahoria, cebolla entre otras hortalizas. Una de las metas que se ha propuesta Benedicto para este año, es incrementar mas el volumen de  su siembra, ya que conseguido estos espacios para siembra, él tiene la capacidad física para hacerlo, ya que su esposa también lo apoya con mano de obra en las épocas de cosecha.

 Pero uno de las limitantes de Benedicto es que no cuenta con suficiente dinero para la compra de semillas y algunos insumos,  él está interesado en conseguir un préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas y todo lo necesario para su cultivo. Benedicto para pagar este préstamo en posee también de otros ingresos él trabaja también como jornalero en su comunidad esto lo hace en los días libres o los fines de semana. El gran sueño de Benedicto es conseguir el préstamo.
texts.en:
Benedicto has 3 children. He lives with his wife in one of the communities in Solola. He is 30 years old.

Benedicto is a man who likes to coexist with nature and he loves agriculture. In the place where Benedicto lives, a lot of people make a living in this line of work. Benedicto normally plants potatoes, carrots, and onions, among other vegetables. One of the goals that Benedicto has set for himself for this year is to further increase the volume of his sowing. He has obtained the space to plant in, and he has the physical capacity to do it. His wife also helps him with the manual labor during the harvest season. 

However, one of the limiting factors for Benedicto is that he does not have enough money to buy seeds and certain supplies. He is interested in obtaining a loan to invest in buying seeds and everything necessary for his crops. Benedicto, to pay this loan, also has other income. He also works as a day laborer in his community. He does this on his free days or on the weekends. Benedicto’s greatest dream is to obtain the loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Grace

texts.es: Grace tiene la edad  de 34 años, está soltera, vive con el hijo que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida .  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Élla no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Grace is 34, single, lives with her son who is her main priority.  With the loan she plans to buy some coffee seedlings to replant when the rain season starts.  This is with the goal to increase the plant density in the area and take advantage of the good fertility of the soil, the weather conditions and other reasons that help to plant coffee.  With the improvements to her coffee plantation she hopes to obtain more profits and improve her life conditions.  This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR.  She had not have previous loans with state banks but FUDECOSUR gave her credit facilities and a very low interest rate.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings.

loans.name: La Bendición 2 Group

texts.es:
La Bendición 2 es el nombre de un grupo ubicado en una zona cañera donde la fuente principal de empleo es el campo. El nombre de la asociación lo eligieron las clientas ya que para ellas es una bendición contar con una actividad que les genera ingresos para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias. Los integrantes son:

Maura -Merceria
Roberta -Refrescos
Alma -Dulces
Sabina -Ropa
Josefina -Refrescos
Elena –Dulces 
Angel -Tortillas
Imelda –Bolsas

Ángel es un chico muy trabajador, tiene 21 años de edad, estudió la preparatoria y desde hace 7 meses decidió auto emplearse vendiendo tortillas. Cada día vende aproximadamente 100 kilos de este tradicional elemento de la cocina mexicana. Con las ganancias, apoya a su madre con los gastos de la casa y satisface sus necesidades personales. 

Esta es la segunda ocasión que Ángel solicita un préstamo y lo quiere destinar para comprar la llanta trasera de la motocicleta que utiliza para transportar las tortillas. “Comenzaré a ahorrar las ganancias para iniciar, si Dios quiere, la licenciatura en sistema sabatino, pues no pues no pretendo vender tortillas toda la vida”.

Para Ángel, esta pequeña actividad es sólo un medio, también está considerando la idea de poner un taller de reparación de motos, de esta manera venderá tortillas por la mañana iniciando de 6:00 am y terminando a las 2:00 pm para componer motos por las  tardes de 4:00 pm a 8:00 pm e incrementar sus ahorros.

*Tanto en la  fotografía como en el grupo, Ángel es el único hombre, la fotografía fue tomada en el patio de su casa debajo del almendro donde suele sentarse a descansar por las tardes con su mamá.
texts.en:
The name of this group is “La Bendición 2” [The Blessing 2].  It is located in a sugarcane area, where the main source of employment is farming. The group’s name was chosen by its members, because for them, it is a blessing to have occupations that generate income for them to provide their families with a better quality of life.  The members are Maura, who sells sewing supplies; Roberta and Josefina, who sell soft drinks; Alma and Elena, who sell sweets; Sabina, who sells clothing; Ángel, who sells tortillas; and Imelda, who sells handbags.


Ángel is a very hardworking young man, age 21.  He completed high school, and 7 months ago he decided to work for himself, selling tortillas. Every day he sells approximately 100 kilos of this traditional Mexican food; and with the earnings, he helps his mother with the household expenses and meets his personal needs.

This is the second time that Ángel is requesting a loan; he wants to use it to purchase a rear wheel for the motorcycle that he uses for transporting the tortillas.  He says, “I’m going to start saving my earnings in order to begin—God willing—studying for the bachelor’s degree on Saturdays, because I don’t want to sell tortillas all my life”. 


For Ángel, this small business is just one means of moving forward; he is also thinking about opening a motorcycle repair shop. This way, he will increase his savings by selling tortillas in the morning from 6:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m., and fixing motorcycles in the afternoon from 4:00 p.m. until 8:00 p.m.

Ángel is the only man in the group, as well as the photo.  It was taken in his yard, beneath the almond tree where he usually sits to rest in the afternoons with his mother.

loans.use: to purchase a rear wheel for a motorcycle.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
El socio Fabian  se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte, el socio tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante  , el socio trabaja 87 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es comprarse un carro nuevo. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Fabian, continues to work in the transportation business. He has a car that he uses as a taxi service. He wants to get ahead through this business. He has already been in this business for eight years and it is going very well. His dream is to have a new car. He is asking for a loan to buy tires for his car.

He is happy about the loan and he promises to complete his payment according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Carmen Josefina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al trabajo como secretaria,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de venta de ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues working as a secretary. She wants to get ahead through this job. Her dream is to have a clothing store. She is requesting this loan to purchase sound equipment for her home. 

This member is grateful for the loan, and she promises to comply with her established repayment plan.

loans.use: to purchase sound equipment for her home.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena engages in selling rtw (ready-to-wear). She sells ladies’ dresses, t-shirts, pants, shorts, and children's wear. She is a 36-year-old married woman with a 9-year-old son. She lives in Talibon, Bohol.

Lorena is asking for a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to buy various clothes and additional capital for rtw. This will help Lorena display a variety of apparel and could possibly attract more customers. She could now start to pay her loans and other household expenses. She could also provide good food and better living conditions.

Lorena dreams to expand her business and become a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to buy various clothes and additional capital for her rtw (ready-to-wear) business.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is from the community of Carles, Iloilo. She is married to a fisherman. For the last 20 years, they have relied on fishing to support their family. Her three children are ages 10, 12, and 18. She is asking for a loan of 35,000 PHP to buy one drum of crude oil and fishing nets. This will allow her to continue fishing for a long time without having to worry about fuel and the quality of her fishing nets. Her income will finance her children's schooling.

In the future, she hope to increase her investment for her family to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy one drum of crude oil and fishing nets

loans.name: Las Mujeres De San Blas Group

texts.es: Mujeres de San Blas es un grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras, es coordinado por Concepción una joven de 19 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos de las edades de 1 y 4 años, quienes han sido su mayor fuerza de superación, se dedica a la comercialización de verduras de manera ambulante, es primera vez que solicita a ADIM el financiamiento para su negocio, y lo solicita para la compra de ayote, tomate, quequisque, chayote, zanahoria, etc. Otra de las integrantes en María de la Concepción quien tiene la edad de 30 años se dedica a la comercialización de verduras en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace trece años, y Yaoska de 25 años de edad, dedicada a la comercialización de ropa interior y cosméticos AVON desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
Mujeres de San Blas (Women of San Blaus) is a supportive group comprised of three entrepreneurial women. Concepción, a 19-year-old young woman, is the group's coordinator. Concepción is married and has two children ages 1 and 4. Her kids are her biggest driving force to succeed. She makes a living selling vegetables from an ambulatory cart. This is the first loan that Concepción has requested from ADIM. This loan will help her business; she is requesting it to buy different kinds of squash, tomatoes, carrots, etc.

The other group members are Maria de la Concepción, who is 30 years old and has made a living selling vegetables for the last three years, and Yaoska, who is 25 years old and has been selling underwear and AVON cosmetics for the last two years.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to increase the products she offers.

loans.name: Ma. Cherry

texts.en:
Ma. Cherry is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She runs a sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Ma. Cherry has been in the business for more than 17 years now.

Ma. Cherry is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, bananas, condiments, and others. With a loan, Ma. Cherry hopes to augment her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.

In the future, Ma. Cherry hopes to make her business a sustainable one. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, bananas, condiments, and others.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. Helen is married and has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of bananas to sell.

Helen has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is 26 years old and married with one child in school. Jeanette works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell.

Jeanette has been in this business for five years.

In the future Jeanette would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene has always the enthusiasm for managing her farming activities, from which she earns a meager income, helping her husband in support of their family. At the age of 42 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family, most especially for her children's education. She has never stopped pursuing her goals for the benefit of her family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her farming activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for labor costs in land preparation for growing crops. In the future, Arlene wishes to own a motor cab for easy transport of her produce to any marketplace in the municipality.

loans.use: to pay for labor cost in land preparation for growing crops

loans.name: Jelyda

texts.en:
Jelyda works hard to support her family. Jelyda is married and has a buy-and-sell crab business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of crabs to sell.

Jelyda has been in this business for three years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Jelyda would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of crabs to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 52 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school. Elsa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

Elsa has been in this business for ten years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 39 years old and married with four children who are in school, Maribeth works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy/sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Maribeth has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Maribeth would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 31 years old and has six children.  She is married and four of her children are in school.

She is in an agricultural business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Imelda requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a goat, cow, and other livestock to sell.  Imelda has been buying and selling livestock for 4 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a goat, cow, and other livestock to sell

loans.name: Josue Omar

texts.es:
El socio Josue Omar se sigue dedicando al negocio de ejecutivo de ventas,el socio por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es tener un negocio de propio como una agnecia de viajes.El socio solicita el credito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Josue Omar is still working as a sales manager. Through this business he hopes to help his family get ahead. Josue Omar dreams of opening his own business: a travel agency. He is requesting this loan to buy a television for his house. 

Josue Omar is happy to have this loan and pledges to make all the scheduled repayments.

loans.use: to buy a television for his house.

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en:
Jhona works hard to support her family. Jhona is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and maintenance for her motorcycle.



Jhona has been in this business for eight years now. In the future she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and maintenance for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 50 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell gasoline business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Helen has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell gasoline business for two years and also earns an income from selling pre-paid mobile loads.

She aspires to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Jeannie

texts.en:
Jeannie works hard to support her family. Jeannie is married and has a manicure and pedicure (service) business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like nail polish, nipper, etc. 

Jeannie has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Jeannie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like nail polish, nipper, etc.

loans.name: Mamela

texts.en:
Mamela is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mamela is 44 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Mamela has a furniture making business in the Philippines. Mamela requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials like woods, nails, paints, etc. for her business.

Mamela has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Mamela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like woods, nails, paints, etc. for her business

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 55 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nelia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nelia has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. Rosalie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 50 years old and married.  

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Jocelyn has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: El Manantial Group

texts.es: El Manantial está integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras que solicitan por primera vez en ADIM el financiamiento para sus negocio. Es coordinado por Ericka una mujer de 27 años de edad, soltera, que ofrece el servicio de venta de comida y refresco en los proyectos de construcción de viviendas, este negocio lo impulsó hace doce años, cuando su mamá le brindó el financiamiento para su negocio. Solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, arroz, leña, platos desechables, platos térmicos, bolsas, plátanos verdes, plátano maduro, repollo, etc., con el objetivo de mejorar los ingresos percibidos por su negocio. El resto de los integrantes son, Dalia de 25 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace un años, y Virginia una joven de 21 años de edad quien compra y vende cosechas en el mercado de su municipalidad desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
El Manantial is comprised of three entrepreneurial women who are requesting their first business loans through ADIM. The group coordinator is Ericka, a 27-year-old woman. She is not married and she works selling food and soft drinks in the housing construction projects. She opened her business two years ago when her mother loan her money to start up the business. Ericka is requesting this loan in order to buy oil, rice, wood, disposable plates, thermal plates, bags, plantains, cabbage, etc. so that she can increase her income from her business. 

The other group members are Dalia, who is 25 years old and has sold produce in the municipal market for the last year, and Virginia, a 21-year-old young woman who has been selling produce in the municipal market for two years.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and improve her quality of service.

loans.name: El Rostro De Dios Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario El Rostro de Dios lo conforman tres microempresarias laboriosas que solicitan el financiamiento en ADIM por tercera vez, quien lo coordina es la señora Yorleni, una mujer de 28 años de edad, soltera, que se dedica a la venta de accesorios para celulares ambulante en el mercado más populoso de la capital, el crédito lo solicita para la compra cargadores para celulares Nokia y Soni Ericson, cargadores universales, protectores y auriculares, ya que son los productos que más demanda tienen. El resto de las integrantes son, Paubla una joven de 23 años de edad y quien comercializa ropa nueva en su comunidad desde hace un año, y Lourdes una mujer de 30 años de edad, comerciante de ropa 6nueva en su comunidad.
texts.en:
The supportive group "El Rostro de Dios" ["The Face of God"] is made up of three hardworking micro-businesswomen who are requesting financing from ADIM for the third time. 

Yorleni is the one who coordinates this group; she is a 28-year-old single woman who earns her living selling celular phone accessories as a street vendor in the most populous market of the capital. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of chargers for Nokia and Sony Ericsson celular phones, universal chargers, cases, and headphones, as those are the most in-demand products. 

The rest of the members are Paubla, a 23-year-old young woman who has sold new clothes in her community for one year, and Lourdes, a 30-year-old woman who sells new clothes in her community.

loans.use: to buy celular phone accessories, as these products are in high demand for part of the population

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 29-years-old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Jenny has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 3 years and also earns an income from buying and selling frozen food.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 48 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Gina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Gina has been in this business for 5 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 40-years-old and married with three children, who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like coffee, milk, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from buying and selling dressed chicken.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like coffee, milk, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Elnora sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy gardening materials and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could further improve her business if you will let her borrow again, this time for an amount of 19,000 PHP. This new loan will go to the maintenance of her gardening farm. She will buy additional gardening materials like wire and basket and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Elnora hopes to meet new regular customers to market and deliver their products. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and other farming supplies

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Aileen works hard to support her family.

She has a barber shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing.  Aileen is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her barber shop.

Aileen has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her barber shop.

loans.name: Peñaflor

texts.en:
Peñaflor works hard to support her family. Peñaflor is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Peñaflor requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, noodles, etc. for her food production business.

Peñaflor has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Peñaflor would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, noodles, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 54-years-old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been pig fattening for 5 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 31-years-old and married with two children, who are in school.  Joan works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell.

Joan has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future, Joan would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a business buying and selling herbal medicines in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of herbal medicines to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of herbal medicines to sell

loans.name: Girly

texts.en:
Girly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business like sugar, cooking oil, milk, flour, margarine, etc.

Girly has been in this business for 3 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling coconut. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, milk, flour, margarine, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy party decorations

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 45 years old and married with two children, who are in school. Grace works very hard to provide for them.

She buys and sells feed in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed to sell.

Grace has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed to sell.

loans.name: Joesa

texts.en:
Joesa is 51 years old and married and works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Joesa has been in this business for four years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 20 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Joelinda

texts.en:
Joelinda is 52 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Joelinda has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future Joelinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the credentialing course of his Systems Engineer degree.

loans.name: Sin Bandera Group

texts.es: Sin bandera es un grupo solidario integrado por tres socios emprendedores que solicitan por tercera vez el financiamiento en ADIM para sus negocios, quien lo coordina es Pamela una mujer de 30 años de edad, casada, que se dedica al destace de cerdo en su domicilio desde hace diez años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de tres cerdos en pie, con el objetivo de cubrir la demanda que tiene de estos productos. El resto de los integrantes son, el señor José de 41 años de edad, quien es agricultor y se dedica a la venta de leña desde hace cinco años, y la señora Justa de 50 años de edad quien realiza derivados del maíz desde hace treinta años.
texts.en:
The Sin Banderas Group is a unified group made up of three entrepreneurial partners who are requesting a loan from ADIM for the third time for their businesses. 

Pamela their coordinator, is 30 and married. For the past 10 years she has butchered hogs in her home. She is requesting the loan to buy three hogs to cover the demand she has for these products. 

The other partners are Jose, 41 who is a farmer and for the past 5 years has also sold firewood. And Justa, 50, who has made food using corn for the past 30 years.

loans.use: buy three hogs which will allow for the increase in offered products.

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es:
La Sra. Mirta tiene una despensa desde el año 2010, es una persona muy trabajadora, que esta luchando por poder crecer para poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella comenta que ha ido creciendo poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo, y hoy ya tiene una muy buena clientela, que siempre le hace muchos pedidos de todos los productos que vende.
El préstamo lo pide para poder comprar insumos varios para la venta, como ser verduras, carnes, frutas, lácteos, bebidas varias y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Mirta has owned a store since 2010. She is a hard working person striving to grow in order to help her family.

She notes that she has been growing little by little through a lot of effort and that she now has very good clientele who place many orders for all the products that she sells.

She is requesting the loan in order to buy various inputs for sale like vegetables, meat, fruit, milk products, various drinks and more. She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fruit, milk products, various drinks and more.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Jonah has been in this business for 7 years now. In the future, she will save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Joribel

texts.en:
Joribel is 45 years old and married with two children who are in school; Joribel works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a direct sales business of Avon products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of Avon products to sell. Joribel has been in this business for 14 years. 

In the future Joribel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of Avon products to sell

loans.name: Tereza Del Carmen

texts.es:
doña Tereza  continua con su lucha de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y que mejor forma que mejorando su vivienda ella labora al igual que su esposo los dos contribuyen con los gastos del hogar. tiene dos hijas mayores de edad quienes estudian en la universidad.
ella solicita este crédito para la compra de ventanas y cemento para realizar unas mejorar en sus casa. Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le brindan ya que sus sueños los ha visto cumplirse.
texts.en:
Tereza continues her fight to improve her living conditions by improving her house. Her and her husband both work and contribute to the household expenses. They have two adult daughters who are studying in the university.
 
She is requesting this loan to buy windows and and cement for her house. 

She appreciates the support given by Kiva and Afodenic as her dreams have come true.

loans.use: to buy windows.

loans.name: Leoneta

texts.en:
Leoneta is 58 years old and married with five children; she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling coconut in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more coconut to sell. Leoneta has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Leoneta would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more coconut to sell

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 40 years old and married, with two children who are in school. Lorena works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a frozen food business in the Philippines and has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional frozen foods to sell.

Lorena has been in this business for 21 years, and in the future she will save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is 28 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Ludy has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Ludy aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy yuca, carrots, pumpkins, oranges, chayote, quequisque root, etc., to diversify her products

loans.name: Melba

texts.en: Melba started selling a variety of vegetables when she was 46 years old. She is married and has three children. Melba also has calamansi (citrus) farmland with 200 trees. She is thankful because her husband is supportive in running their businesses. Melba would like to keep her vegetable vending activity, but her capital is not enough. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 which allows her to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her vegetable farmland. She believes that this loan amount will enable her to obtain greater income and improve her calamansi farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her vegetable farmland

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elvie is 52 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Elvie has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Elvie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Elvie has been in this business for 32 years. In the future, Elvie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Rebecca successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Rebecca's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 54 years old and has seven children. Avelina is married and has five children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Avelina requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Avelina has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Avelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 44 years old and married. 

Cristina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cristina has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain this. 

In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 55 years old, married to a farmer, and blessed with four children. She owns and manages a retail store in their village for almost one year, and earns a net income of PHP 300 daily. Her net income on this business is usually spent on their daily expenses. Due to insufficient funds from her business, she would like to request a loan of PHP 35,000, to purchase coffee, sugar, detergent soap, beverages, and soap to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, sugar, detergent soap, beverages, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en: Guillerma is 46 years old and residing at Tangub City, Philippines. She is married and blessed only with two adult children. She joined PMPC on May 17, 2011, in order to access the programs and services of the said co-op. Recently, she's applying for a loan in the amount of PHP 3,000 for additional working capital of her existing business to buy a variety of commodities, which is selling a variety of food products in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities

loans.name: Willian

texts.es: Willian tiene la edad  de 48 años, está casado, vive con la esposa y tres hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Willian is 48 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and three children, who are his greatest priority. With the loan, he plans to make the purchase of fertilizers and fungicides and pay for labor for assistance with his coffee plants, in addition to taking advantage of the good fertility of the earth. With these improvements in cultivation, he hopes to obtain some earnings and thus improve the living conditions of his family and also accomplish some goals. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with a better payment plan and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Alcatraz Group

texts.es:
Ubicada en los límites territoriales con otro estado se ubica una comunidad cañera donde se consolidó el grupo llamado Alcatraz nombrado así por el gusto de los integrantes por la flor. El grupo está integrado por: 

Hermenegilda  -Venta De Tacos
Guadalupe –Venta De Refrescos 
Teodora –Venta De Bolis
Yesenia –Venta De Comida 
Adriana –Venta De Chicharrones 
Rufino –Venta De Dulces 

Doña Hermenegilda tiene 43 años de edad, su esposo Crecencio es quien la incorporó hace 8 años a la venta de tacos de barbacoa de borrego. Ellos son padres de tres hijas de las cuales solo una vive con ellos y les apoya los fines de semana en la venta ya que de lunes a a viernes ella trabaja. En promedio, Hermenegilda prepara tres borregos a la semana, preparan la carne y el caldo que forma parte del tradicional platillo. Al principio Crecencio era el encargado de hacer las cuentas y de cobrar ya que Hermanegilda no sabía leer, escribir ni hacer cuentas. "Hace cuatro meses me motivaron a aprender a leer, escribir y hacer las operaciones básicas". Después de la recomendación, ella buscó una escuela para adultos y con orgullo comenta que se ha superado. 

Hermenegilda emplea sus ganancias para comprar manteles, servilletas, sillas, dar mantenimiento a unas bocinas para poner música y alegrar el negocio y a sus clientes mientras disfrutan de la comida. Actualmente, Hermenegilda está interesada en críar sus propios animales para garantizar la calidad de la carne y tener más ganancias. Por esto necesita un préstamo para comprar una borrega preñada.

“Gracias por prestarnos para poder crecer con cada una de nuestras actividades”.

*La fotografía se capturó frente a la casa de Guadalupe. Doña Hermenegilda está cargando a su nieto y viste pantalón rojo.
texts.en:
This cane sugar community is found at the border limits to another state. This is where the group named Alcatraz was formed, so named for the flower that the members like. The group is made up of:

Hermenegilda – Sale of Tacos
Guadalupe – Sale of Drinks 
Teodora – Sale of Bolis (frozen treat)
Yesenia – Sale of Food
Adriana – Sale of Pork Rinds
Rufino – Sale of Sweets

Hermenegilda is 43 years old. Her husband, Crecencio, is who incorporated her, 8 years ago, into the selling of barbecue lamb tacos. They are the parents of three daughters of whom only one lives with them and supports them by selling on the weekends, since she works from Monday through Friday. On average, Hermenegilda prepares three lambs per week. They prepare the meat and the broth that form part of the traditional dish. At the beginning, Crecencio was in charge of accounting and billing since Hermenegilda could not read, write nor keep accounts. “Four months ago they motivated me to learn to read, write and perform basic operations.” After the recommendation, she searched for an adult school and she proudly notes that she has succeeded. 

Hermenegilda uses her earnings to buy tablecloths, napkins and chairs, to maintain speakers for playing music and for cheering up the business and the customers while they enjoy the food. Hermenegilda is currently interested in raising her own animals to guarantee the quality of the meat and to have better earnings. For this, she needs a loan to buy a pregnant lamb. 

“Thank you for lending to us in order to grow each of our businesses.”

*The photograph was taken in front of Guadalupe’s home. Hermenegilda is wearing red pants and carrying her grandson.

loans.use: to buy 1 lamb (pregnant).

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of veterinary products business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice.  Rowena is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of veterinary products to sell for her buy and sell of veterinary products business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of veterinary products to sell

loans.name: Guadalupana Group

texts.es:
Guadalupana es un grupo solidario integrado por tres microempresarios emprendedores, que lo coordina la señora Bertha de 41 años de edad, soltera y madre de un hijo que tiene a cargo, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa nueva en su comunidad y domicilio, este negocio lo impulso hace ocho años, anteriormente trabajaba en una granja, pero con la liquidación impulso su propio negocio, es el décimo tercer ciclo que ADIM le brinda los financiamientos para su negocio y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con espíritu de superación, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de zapatos para damas y caballeros, sandalias altas y bajas, jean para damas, trajes de niños y niñas, etc., una de sus metas es seguir diversificando los productos ofrecidos, una problemática son temporadas bajas, sin embargo este mes es uno de los que mayor demanda se da, los logros han sido varios uno de ellos es que aprendió el hábito del ahorro lo que le permitió comprarse un terreno, lo que le permitirá brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 
Rosa es otra de las integrantes del grupo Guadalupana, tiene la edad de 54 años y su negocio es la venta de hojas, estas son utilizadas para la realización de nacatamales, tamales, etc., los comercializa en los mercados de la capital desde hace cinco años, y el señor Luis que tiene la edad de 56 años  y se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas, comercializándolos en el mercado municipal.
texts.en:
Guadalupana Communal Bank is made up of three enterprising micro-entrepreneurs coordinated by Bertha, 41.  She's single and the mother of a dependent child.  She earns a living selling new clothing in her community and her home.  She started this business eight years ago.  Previously she worked on a farm, but when she left she started her own business.

Bertha's requesting the loan to buy women's and men's shoes, high-heeled and flat sandals, women's jeans, children's clothing, etc.  This is her third loan from ADIM for her business and she has shown herself to be a responsible person with a spirit of self-improvement.

One of her goals is to keep on diversifying the products she sells.  One problem is the slow season, although this month is one of the ones in which demand is highest.  She has had several successes.  She learned the habit of saving, for example.  This allowed her to buy a plot of land, which will help her give her family a better quality of life.

Rosa, 54, is another member of Guadalupana Group.  Her business is selling leaves to make nacatamales, tamales, etc., which she has sold in the markets in the capital for five years.  Luis, 56, earns a living buying and selling harvests to sell in the town market.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, blouses, jeans, and other clothing to diversify her variety

loans.name: Karlo

texts.en:
This is Karlo. He sends you his thanks for your generosity, because his previous loan has enhanced his business. He was able to buy spare parts and accessories for his vehicle. The loan also helped him provide for his family's daily needs and expenditures.

He is very positive that he could improve his business more if you will let him borrow again in the amount of 20,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of accessories and spare parts of his jeepney. Simultaneously, he could sustain the needs of his family if the unit is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Karlo wants to buy another jeepney unit for his transportation business and he also desires to have an additional source of income like a variety store. He meets every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work, and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his jeepney unit.

loans.name: Restauración Del Valle Group

texts.es: Restauración del Valle está integrado por tres socios laboriosos, coordinado por Mirna una mujer de 38 años de edad, acompañada, comerciante de frutas y verduras en el departamento de Boaco  desde hace diez años, es primer ciclo que solicita el crédito en ADIM, e invertirá en tamarindo, sandía, yuca, papaya y cebolla. También lo integran, María Auxiliadora una mujer de 26 años de edad y quien se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías y Yeffry un joven de 20 años de edad, su negocio es el destace de cerdo y elaboración de nacatamales desde hace un año en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Restauración del Valle [Restoration of the Valley] is made up of three hard-working members. The group is coordinated by Mirna, a 38-year-old woman who is in a relationship and has been selling fruits and vegetables in the department of Boaco for ten years. This is the first cycle in which Mirna has requested a loan with ADIM, and she will invest in tamarinds, watermelons, yuca, papayas, and onions.

Another member is María Auxiliadora, a 26-year-old woman who works making handicrafts. Twenty-year-old Yeffry is also a member. His business is butchering pigs and making nacatamales [a meat, corn, and rice Nicaraguan delicacy] at his house, which he has been doing for one year.

loans.use: to buy tamarinds, onions, yuca, watermelons, and papayas, since these are the most sought after items by people.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 48 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Anecita has a bakery business in the Philippines. Anecita requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, butter, etc. for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Anecita has been in this business for 16 years. Anecita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, butter, etc. for her business

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 52 years old and has six children. Emelyn is married and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Emelyn requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed.

Emelyn has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain this. 

In the future, Emelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Keylin

texts.es: Keylin es una joven que quiere salir adelante y actualmente no encuentra trabajo en la localidad. Es por esto que ha decidido seguir con la fabricación de artesanías. Sin embargo necesita de un capital para poder comprar los materiales necesarios para fabricarlos. Ella necesita un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para poder comprar lo necesario. Para ella esto significa poder conseguir el dinero necesario para el sustento de su familia y de su hijo.
texts.en: Keylin is a young woman who wants to move ahead, and currently does not find work in her community. This is why she has decided to continue producing handcrafts. However, she needs capital to be able to buy the needed materials to produce them. She needs a loan of a million colones (1.000.000) to be able to buy what is needed. For her this means being able to get the needed money to support her family and her son.

loans.use: to buy materials for handcrafts.

loans.name: Kuña Juky Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Juky está en el ciclo 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, todas forman parte también del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, a través del cual, todas han ido mejorando con su esfuerzo, y su lucha.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sandra ella  es cliente de la Fundación hace varios años,  se desempeña como directora de general,  ella a la vez se dedica a la venta de termos forrados y cosméticos sobre pedidos, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar cosméticos variados y también termos, para que de esa forma siga con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, luchando día a día.
texts.en:
The Kuña Juky group is in the seventh cycle of the women's communal bank program.  All are participating in the poverty elimination program, through which they have all gradually improved their effort and determination.

One of the members is Sandra. She is been a client of the foundation for several years and works as a manager. At the same time she sells insulated thermoses, and cosmetics by order. She is a very hard-working and determined woman. She is asking for this loan so that she can buy a variety of cosmetics as well as insulated thermoses and in that way continue selling as she has been doing, striving day by day.

loans.use: To buy a variety of cosmetics as well as thermoses.

loans.name: M.m.e Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado M.M.E está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, a través del cual podrán conocer la situación de vida de cada una e ir mejorándola.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cinthia, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, y comenta que siempre trata de poder incentivar a sus compañeras del grupo para poder crecer y salir adelante. Cinthia se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace, y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante, es una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carne, condimentos, y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas y sus esfuerzos de ir mejorando. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
M.M.E. Group is in its fifth loan cycle in the women's bank program.  They're also part of the "Poverty Stoplight" program through which each one will be able to learn her living situation and keep on improving it.

One of the members is Cinthia, who's the president of the group.  She said she always tries to inspire her colleagues in the group to grow and get ahead.  Cynthia earns a living selling food that she herself makes and goes out to sell in the street.  She's a very committed and determined woman.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, and other ingredients so she can keep on making sales and improving.

All the women are grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, and other ingredients to make food

loans.name: Mujeres Responsables Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo llamado “Mujeres Responsables”, ellas luchan por sus familias, para poder darles una mejor vida. Están además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Francis es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes varios, y comenta que le está yendo muy bien, ya que siempre tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes, Gracias a su lucha diaria, ayuda a su familia, dándoles lo que necesitan para una vida digna.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de perfumes variados, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: There are 17 women who are part of the group called “Mujeres Responsables” (Responsible Women). They work hard for their families so they can give them a better life. They are also part of the program to eliminate poverty. Francis is one of the members of this group. She works selling different perfumes, and she says she is doing very well, because she has many orders from her customers. Thanks to her daily struggle, she helps her family and gives them what they need for a worthy life. She is requesting a loan to buy different perfumes, in order to continue with her sales, struggling for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy different perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Edencia

texts.en:
Edencia is 46 years old and has six children. Edencia is married and two of her children are in school.

Edencia is in the agricultural business raising cattle in the Philippines. Edencia requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her cattle.

Edencia has been in this business for 4 years, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edencia would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her cattle

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evangeline is 28 years old.

Evangeline has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items needed for her business.

Evangeline has been in this business for five years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items needed for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos  tiene la edad  de 52 años, está casado, vive con la esposa y dos  hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para la palma aseitera, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Carlos, 52 years old, is married and he lives with his wife and two children who are his top priority.

With this loan, he plans to buy fertilizers and fungicides, as well as pay for labor to assist him with his oil palms, so as to make the most of the good soil fertility. 

He hopes to get some profits from the improved crops, and thus improve living conditions for his family as well as accomplish some goals.

This is the first loan that he receives from FUDECOSUR. He has not had previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy inputs for his oil palms.

loans.name: Santa Cruz Group

texts.es:
Damaris es una mujer de 24 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 4 años, y su negocio es la venta de carne.
Ella es buena madre, dulce, cariñosa, sensible, sincera, generosa, comprensiva, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘plan 3000’ sitio que se ha convertido en un pujante brazo de producción donde microempresarios de todas las áreas, como la costura, el diseño y las artesanías, imitan productos extranjeros que se comercializan en los principales mercados locales, Los habitantes de la populosa zona son en su gran mayoría migrantes del occidente del país como mineros relocalizados y etnias nativas del lugar como los ‘Ayoreos’. De clima cálido tropical y muy húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Damaris es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que aún no están en edad escolar y viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con electricidad, agua potable y alcantarillado (sentada a la derecha, usa polera roja). La necesidad por darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos la hizo formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de productos cosméticos, venta de poleras, venta de mandiles, venta de chompas de alpaca, venta de polleras, venta de chamarras para niños y taller de soldadura, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de carne, la cual realiza en un puesto de venta bajo techo, realizando la compra directa desde el matadero municipal, los cortes de vacuno como el huachalomo, abastero y el asado carnicero son los favoritos de los consumidores locales en diciembre. "son muchas las familias que optan por cortes de carnes finas para prepararlas al horno, a la cacerola y, por supuesto, asadas, como alternativas diferentes al pavo, que hace mucho dejó de ser el ingrediente infaltable de las cenas de fin de año…" comenta. Su sueño es tener una carnicería grande para vender por mayor y menor. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de una congeladora de carne para tener a disposición mayor cantidad de producto. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Damaris solicita un préstamo para la compra de una congeladora de carne para contar con mayor cantidad de producto para vender.
texts.en:
Damaris is a woman of 24. She is single and has two children, ages 3 and 4. Her business is selling meat.

She is a good mother, gentle, caring, responsive, sincere, generous, understanding, responsible, and hard-working.
