Her business is located in the zone of the "Plan 3000" location, which has become a vigorous arm of production where microbusinesses in all areas, such as making clothing, design, and handicrafts, imitate foreign products that are sold in the principal local markets. The inhabitants of the populous area are in large part migrants from the western part of the country, as well as relocated miners and native groups from the area, such as the Ayoreos. It has a warm and very humid tropical climate, with a temperature that varies between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade during the day.

Damaris has a dark complexion and long, tied-back black hair. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish because of general culture and for the business that she does. She shares her life with her children, who are not yet of school age, and they live in a rented house that has electricity, potable water, and sewer service. (She is seated on the right and is wearing a red shirt.) The need to give her children a better future led her to form a bank with people with businesses such as selling cosmetic products, selling t-shirts, selling aprons, selling alpaca sweaters, selling skirts, selling children's jackets, and a soldering workshop, in order to apply for a loan and expand their businesses. 

Her business is selling meat, which she does in a sales stall under a roof. She makes purchases directly from the town butcher. The cuts of beef such as sirloin steak, shanks, and butcher's roast are the favorites of the local customers in December. "There are many families who choose fine cuts of meat to prepare in the oven, in casseroles, and, of course, roasted, as different alternatives to turkey, which some time ago stopped being the essential ingredient of end-of-year dinners," she comments. Her dream is to have a big butcher shop to sell wholesale and retail. She wants to make an investment in her business through the purchase of a meat freezer, in order to have a greater quantity of product on hand. This is her first sequence of loans with the institution in the five years that she has had this business.

It is for these reasons that Damaris is applying for a loan to purchase a freezer for meat in order to have a greater quantity of product to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer for meat in order to have a greater quantity of product to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Kuña Guapa es un grupo unido con 17 integrantes, todas con muy buenas expectativas sobre las actividades que están realizando, cada una con metas propias para lograr mejorar la situación de vida de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes que se caracteriza por ser  muy emprendedora es la Sra. Ramona quien se dedica a la cría de animales, y  vende sus productos como queso, mandioca, verduras y otros. Todas las integrantes de este grupo son mujeres trabajadoras rurales.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y también semillas para su siembra. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group is called Kuña Guapa, it's a united group with 17 members, they all have very good expectations about the activities they are working on.  Each of them has their own goals to improve the life situation of their families.
One of the members of the group is characterized for being very entrepreneurial, her name is Ramona and she has livestock and sells products such as cheese, yuca, vegetables and others.  All the members of the group are rural hardworking women.
She requests a loan to invest it in buying feed for her livestock and seed for their land.
She is grateful for the opportunity to continue with her micro enterprise.

loans.use: to buy feed for her livestock and seed for her land.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Florencia is 42 years old and three of her children are in school.

Florencia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Florencia requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Florencia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Florencia would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Luisa is 39 years old and all of her children are in school.

Luisa has a business buying and selling household products in the Philippines. Luisa requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more household products to sell.

Luisa has been in this business for six years. In the future, Luisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more household products to sell.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Librada forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas las integrantes, a través de su trabajo y esfuerzo, quieren ir mejorando la situación de pobreza de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Julia quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir que esta en un nivel de pobreza extremo, donde a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de comidas está tratando de mejorar. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere ir creciendo cada día.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de verduras, carnes, condimentos, y otros insumos para poder seguir con la venta de sus comidas y de esa forma seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called Santa Librada is part of the poverty elimination program.  All the members through work and effort want to reduce their poverty situation one by one.
One of the members is Julia who in the last survey had a poverty level 1, which means extreme poverty, where through effort and continues work and by selling food she is trying to improve.  She is a very hardworking person and a fighter that wants to grow each day.
She requests the loan to buy vegetables, meat, condiments and other ingredients to continue selling food and continue working like she has been in the past.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments and other ingredients to continue selling food.

loans.name: Barrio Unido Group

texts.es:
22 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, son mujeres jefas de familia, que luchan por sus seres queridos, y para poder ir mejorando poco a poco y con esfuerzo la situación de pobreza de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Vidalina, quien es la Directora del grupo, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha mejorado su situación de pobreza extrema, pero debe seguir esforzándose para poder seguir. Ella se dedica a hacer comidas varias, y por medio de ello ayuda a su familia y les da lo que necesitan para el día a día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carnes, condimentos, pollo y demás, de manera a poder seguir haciendo sus comidas y seguir luchando por crecer y salir adelante. Agradece por la ayuda que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y luchando.
texts.en:
22 women form this group. They are heads of their family, they fight for their loved ones and to improve with effort little by little the poverty situation of each of them.
One of the members is Vidalina, who is the group director and in her last survey she had a poverty level 3, which means she has improved from extreme poverty but has to continue making an effort.  She works selling different types of food, through it she helps her family and gives them what they need each day.
She requests a loan to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, chicken and other items. This way she will be able to continue making food and fighting to grow and get ahead.  She is grateful for the help that she receives to grow and fight.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, chicken and other items to make food for sale.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Mary Grace works hard to support her family. She sells vegetables in the Philippines and earns additional income by raising and selling pigs.

Mary Grace has been supporting her work through her past four loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell.

Mary Grace hopes that her hard work will help her save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. She sews school uniforms and repairs clothing. This is her only source of income, and she is very grateful for her life and ability to be independent.

Mercy applied for a 7,000 PHP loan through PMPC in order to buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. With this loan she will be able to offer more tailoring services, increase production and so generate more income.

loans.use: buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is 50 years old and married with five children.

Cleofe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Cleofe has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Cleofe aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.
